fqZ4q0tL8chJ_vJWALMfnA.review_text: Loved this hip bar! The bartenders were very nice and made me a great martini, atmophere was fun and playfull. Even the double stall (or lack there of) in the bathroom cracked me up. Shot some pool and ordered a pulled pork sandwich that blew my mind with flavor that was outta sight! Dear Mom, I will come back for more. From, Eme.

kdFUM8jwXDcOhxJ0k3SoFQ.review_text: super nice tenders. great food from Laurent. will be back for sure. thanks dear mom dudes.

DUGfV_bCL14QXdOyyG-saw.review_text: I went here last weekend and ordered The Burger. It blew my mind, it was so good. The ingredients were so fresh and the combo together was so tasty. My friend ordered the Papas Fritas and they were delicious as well. The atmosphere was chill and welcoming. I will DEFINITELY be going back soon.

pAOfQZX3jD1f0kS569tzZw.review_text: Good time all around. PBR & Jameson shot for $7 sure did the trick all night. Really good food too!

u19H4x_V9pUjLY4a1jc3tw.review_text: Awesome burger if a bit overpriced.  Beer selection will appeal to IPA lovers.  Happy to have this place in the neighborhood.  To my original review I would add the following:  Outstanding burger.  Rivals the the best in SF (may be the best; another trip will tell).  Terrific bartender.  Still though, I wish the beers weren't $6 each on a Saturday with few patrons.

tgUvk_rJXFr24q-X7I1U2A.review_text: My Giant loves this place, so we went in yesterday (Monday July 2nd) to see if we could reserve a table for his birthday. The bartender, Paul, was awesome. He made sure to let me know that they would accomodate, reserved us the big table in the front, and is going to allow me to bring in my cheesy Star Wars decor. :)    And we couldn't just go to Dear Mom for just a reservation. This is the second time I've been there and the food never disappoints!  I had chipotle wings with a blue cheese dressing that I LOVE!  Best blue cheese!!!  Of course, I had to have a coctail while I was there too.  Heck, it was happy hour!!  Love this place - recommend it for everyone!  Space and decor is great, and welcoming.

OXYtOFX9xXukagW5Ku5dfg.review_text: Some friends and I were looking to go bar hopping one night. We had a bar in mind but while we were looking for parking, I saw this place and decided that we needed to check it out.  The place itself has modest decor. Dim lighting via interesting, hanging light bulbs, chalkboard menus, wooden furnishings, games, a photo booth....honestly the most hipster bar I have ever set foot in. It's also rather spacious with a good amount of seating. It was pretty packed for a Sunday night so we sat at the bar.   Service was friendly and patient. Really chill people who seem to have a lot of character.   I ordered a pint of Anchor Steam ($8) while my friends got Anchor Porter ($9) and water respectively. We also ordered a Spanish Chorizo pizza ($13) for us to share.  The beers were good. I rather like Anchor Steam. The pizza took a little over 10 minutes, but it was quite tasty. They bake the pizza and then pan fry it to make the crust a little crispier. I like that a lot. This is a pretty small pizza though so don't expect a party size.   I really like this place a lot and I do plan to go back one day. Really chill place!

XXi_Q7XMI7I9iqfXi_W42w.review_text: Fun crowd on  a Friday night. But, when it is super crowded it's irritating. Cheap drinks ($4 well!). If you sit down at the tables in the back, there is waiter service.  They also have a rotating art gallery which is fun.   They also have a decent space to rent out for events and give back to the community.  The food is very overpriced for the venue.  $10 for a half cup of mac and cheese? Ripoff.

NCg53EdDxLZrVAF2PQppTw.review_text: Cash only...tough decisions...beer or beef.....dam those burgers look good with my beer goggles....

wJgtf18VKKZq9A6ZQUybQw.review_text: I walked with a friend one Friday night and to say that the exterior does not match the interior is an understatment. I was pleasantly surprised at the vibe and this is a spacious, cool place to hang out with friends, grab a drink, eat a meal, or just kick it. I only had a drink while I was there, but the food menu, as small as it is, looked really appetizing and I would definitely come back.

qPGhjScyxtuHrWXN4A8VXg.review_text: There is so much space in here it makes me want to rollerskate.   Drinks were great, food was fantastic, but the ladies bathroom situation is totally bizarre. It's a lovely bathroom, don't get me wrong. In the absence of stalls, the partition was a nice touch (though you can still see through them). However, that one toilet in the front - the one that's exposed when someone opens the door- that's just a teeny bit awkward.   Apart from that, this place is fabulous.

TsbkNTS0_AzCaRbhhe4C5A.review_text: Don't be fooled by the title, it's unfinished, the full title is actually: "Dear Mom, We're a Bunch of Hipster Dickheads".  I know that sounds harsh, but these people were inexcusably rude.  My boyfriend has been dying to hang out at this bar for ages, so when his birthday rolled around, he decided to make a reservation. He didn't want to risk it getting lost or confused, so we actually walked to the bar to make it in person. This is when I should've noticed the first red flag.  [To preface this, this was NOT a busy night. It wasn't really late and there weren't a million people to attend to.] It took forever to get anyone to talk to us. Everyone who worked there completely ignored us. I stood at the bar in case I could speak to the bartender when he came to ask me what I wanted to drink...mistake, he never asked me what I wanted to drink. I just stood there trying to get his attention like an idiot, until my boyfriend finally just stepped in the path of the server who was ignoring and walking right past us, and asked about a reservation.  They had him write all his information down, told him for the 20-30 people he expected, they'd have to book him the back room, and then said they'd call to confirm.  A whole week passes, no call. My boyfriend calls every single day, can only get through to answering machine, and still no call. However, we weren't THAT worried since it doesn't usually work like this: If it's not confirmed, we won't even bother to call and tell you that.  So finally it's his birthday, we all show up, to bring massive business to this place, and OOPS, they LOST THE RESERVATION, and they gave the room to someone else.  Okay, any decent, professional business would try to compensate for this somehow. Or at the very least apologize profusely. But not Dear Mom! I guess they're above that.  Instead, they pointed to a table that was pushed against the handicap ramp and video game machines (hence making two sides of it inaccessible for anyone to sit) which didn't matter because for our party of 20, they provided us with exactly two chairs; and they told us we could have that. Actually, "provided" is a loose term as that would've required they'd put in any effort at all. The two chairs were already at the table.  Then, they proceeded to completely ignore us for the rest of the night. That's how they treat someone on their birthday, bringing tons of business to their bar, who bothered to try to make a reservation.  TL:DR- Don't bother making a reservation here. Don't expect any kind of kindness, politeness, or the bare minimum of civil customer service, even if it's your damn birthday. What you'll get instead is unfathomably rude and disinterested service, if it can even be called "service".

n9NEd4wwuMs72gffl21AOg.review_text: Hmmmmm, this review is a toughie. Swung by with my brother and some friends last night after having heard that Dear Mom was going to be another SF hotspot. Severely dissappointed in the result.  First the pros: door man was so easy that he didn't even check for ID's. Drinks are served at dirt cheap prices. The interior is a vast space, though there is no interior design to speak of. You've got Foosball tables, pool tables, video games and a massive Connect Four game. Oh, and a photo booth too. All the ingredients for a decent time.  Now the cons: the crowd...just wasn't my scene. Like, at all. Was there even one remotely attractive female there last night? I don't think so. Instead, it was a hodgepodge of hipsters and alternative types. Oh, and there was some random guy walking around all night with his skateboard, so I guess if you're a skater, this would be a good spot for you too.  In reading the comments, I note a distinct sense of disdain for hipsters in this city. I'm not going to hate on hipsters...they need a place to hang out too.  But what can I say? I guess I'm just a mainstream kind of guy. I like my ladies in Size 0, 2 or 4, in mini skirts and heels and with a Chanel or a Birkin. I don't go for Size 12's with multiple eyebrow piercings and 13 tatoos. That's just me.   And so, while freely admitting that this place probably just wasn't meant for a guy like me, I'm going to say that I can't recommend coming to Dear Mom. Especially given it's out-of-the-way location.  And you can trust me on this one; I'm an Elite. ;)

YBtElKhZ2i8KXUSgXwuKZQ.review_text: Beer is great. Food is delicious. I loved their sriracha buffalo chicken sandwich. Very friendly and accommodating. We had a meetup with about 15 people and had an amazing time! Thank you Dear Mom. I'll be back soon!

ReDoGveUTyzlfC0bZOQ3bA.review_text: Very self-aware hipster vibe.. I think the special was PBR and a shot of Jameson? Yuck.   I had a Michter's Old Fashioned that wasn't actually with Michter's because they "ran out"... I saw two bottles in plain view.. couldn't they have at least hidden them? Still, it was fine, and despite the madness at the bar, I got my drinks pretty fast. The bartenders were definitely hustling... never seen hipsters sweat like that.  The photobooth was awesome, and the lighting was fantastic.. got that can see each other, but still totally flattering thing down.. tricky. The pool table was sorta awkwardly placed.. makes for a lot of being poked since the bar is CROWDED.. One of my friends couldn't get in later in the night. I think I'll come back in a few weeks (months?) once things die down.

J9HamWsxKorlPGUAXy-M9Q.review_text: Interesting bar they have here in the Mission district.  It's pretty dark inside but at least there's sunlight shining through the front doors to allow you to have a decent game of foosball.  There's a wide variety of microbrewery beers on tap along with some bottle beers for those weird fellows who hate drinking draught beers.  They do have a kitchen which surprised me as I thought this place was strictly a bar.  The food were fairly priced but nothing too spectacular.  Overall, a jolly good place to go during happy hour.

9FPm9wj_zcBWJuB9-Tlqcw.review_text: Really enjoyed this place. Loved the shape of the bar. Makes it easier to talk to people. LOVED the food. So delicious and pretty reasonably priced. Staff was super nice too. Also, who doesn't love playing Big Buck Hunter in between drinks?

Myy-tV1aKksxkQ2R7QUkAQ.review_text: Not a fancy bar by all means but I quite enjoyed their friendly bartenders and great drink specials on a weekday. There was this Bulleit Bourbon shot and PBR combo for $8 or something, which was interesting. Not my kind of crowd though.

Q0qo1Gi99LihNjitnpfCAw.review_text: Cash Only. Divey, but not really. Kitchen's open until closing. Last call's at 1:05 am.  Good place to go with a group of friends. There are huge tables/booths. It's not too crowded.  There's a full bar. Jukebox with great music. Great people watching! A bit too brightly lit.

nMTE1riYtYBLLAbaXwZA1Q.review_text: Guess you love it or hate it, guess Im just a hater. This place had overly sticky floors its not from sweat since the bartenders are not rushing around to get you drinks, must be a co-op. Anyways I went for food, and they were out of everything, everything that is but condescension. I like a crappy bar, I like a bar where the bartenders are jerks but the drinks are strong, I dig that crap.  But give me my damned drink, yes there are some cute hipster chicks in the place and they need drinks, but I need them too... much more now....         Its still newish, its still getting to its place, hope it gets better since its down the street.

IDdafFBKpl9HPAtMlTmyOw.review_text: Four stars or five? Can't decide! Came here on a date last night and I realllllllllly liked it. I've walked past here so many times and it way surpassed my expectations. Though we were laughing over the 8$ kale tacos (*eye roll*) Cash only !

0CqAmHUSWPEQdrnCbDiaVA.review_text: Surprisingly neat little place in an otherwise unremarkable part of town.  I recommend Dear Mom.  When we went it wasn't too crowded.  Staff was friendly and food was pretty good.  I enjoyed it rather a lot.

hA8et-LncZc1F1_seQl4eg.review_text: Dear Mom has the illusion of being a great bar. When you walk in you think "wow, this place is huge! AND they have Radeburger (sp?) on tap?" Stop yourself there. The bar is huge but they never have enough bartenders. Tonight I waited over 20 minutes for a drink at the bar. Then when i was seated at a booth, I waited over 30 minutes for a waitress, who I requested to the barback every time he came by. When she finally came by , she didnt know what a greyhound was. Enough said. The ladies restroom is a joke- reminds me of the camp latrines as a 10 year old girl scout. And finally, they turn on the lights and begin shouting at you to finish your drinks at 1:15. Yep, 1:15. Does anyone else remember we are in a recession? Do I have to force someone to take my money? Oh wait, they don't want it. Nice try Dear Mom. Fail.

hfFndkuiExobJkSV_Apqfg.review_text: Mom should have raised the staff here better...  After bending over backward to get a reservation for my friends birthday, we arrived at Dear Mom - only to discover that they had completely dropped the ball and given away our semi-private room to some randos who had just walked in. The incredibly unhelpful staff then dismissed us to the worst table possible - a table that literally had two chairs for our party of 20+.  To make matters worse, the drinks were no good. Everything was expensive. Every staff member was a total jerk. It's really too bad, because the space is cool, not too crowded, with a pretty entertaining crowd.  Awful, awful, awful.

ti4lRf8rv9KICw6msOJT0w.review_text: We played the PBR connect four, ate a hot dog and slider. The bartenders had 2 people deep but still managed to deliver a short wait time for drinks.  I'll be back, yes I'll be back.

QpWqxub4dJ97Y65J6t-GDg.review_text: Went in last night after a 12 hour shift for a brew. Great ed by a lovely dark haired bartender with big smiling eyes, i was sitting and enjoying my draft beer  and her company within seconds of walking in. The scene was lively with a good looking crowd and the staff was working harmoniously to keep drinks topped off.

8b9GJsvhIfbyLRyFTbIUqQ.review_text: Good for brown drinks. Great pop-ups for food.

rkag74WYKAPSJ_DvtdfgTQ.review_text: Wifey and I came in to meet a friend one mid-afternoon, and they happily served us some beers while we waited for them to switch from lunch to dinner in the kitchen. Nice atmosphere, friendly staff, I could kick it here.  Then I tried some food. We didnt have too much time so we tried some simple fare. Edamame and Papas Fritas. Let me say that I was blown away by how complicated the "simple fare" was. The Edamame was soaked in the perfect amount of lemongrass and sesame seed, it was terrific by itself. Then I tried the Papas Fritas. It is a delectable and cheesy comfort food with a bit of heat to it. Impressive. Definitely recommend this spot, in the daytime anyway. Ill be back.

StJ9m1-R2EGNJVS6CJl4SQ.review_text: I didn't try their food. I was there with friends and drinks :) Enjoyed my time definitely. Nice hip bar!

PQPk3yifh1O0C7tYAmGfLg.review_text: +4 for service - Olvier, Matty Bo, Big Nate, and Jean Jean are at the top of their game. Let them take care of you - they're in it to win it.   +4 for the bar food - listen - trust me on this one - get the steamed hot dog in baguette - it's bomblicious.

adKonsQWY64vJYglPotH5Q.review_text: I pass this place every once in awhile so I decided to come here with my friend. It's kinda confusing when you walk in if you haven't been to Dear Mom before. There's a bar in the center of the room and I think most people just come here for a drink, but there is an option to be seated if you approach a waitress and say that you want to eat something.  The menu is disorganized and doesn't make sense. It looks like someone just threw everything onto a piece of paper. It's not in order of price or separated into appetizers and entrees. Nevertheless, we ordered the Papa Fritas and Buffalo Burger. YUM the Papa Fritas ($8) are cut potatoes with cotija cheese, chile, tapatio aioli, green onion, cilantro, and lime. The tapatio aioli makes this dish AMAZING. I already know I'm going to have specific cravings for this later. The Sriracha Buffalo Chicken Sandwich ($12) has lettuce, onions, tapatío aioli, and scallion sour cream... served with waffle fries. The waffles fries are okay but I love the sufficiently spicy buffalo chicken. So tasty! Good place to lowkey come in and just get some upscale bar food and a beer... granted they don't run out of the beer on tap like what happened to me.

nbfyMmgqnxXIp7EDqTmkqw.review_text: They have a lot of pop up restaurants here (brunch and dinner hours) and man are the results tasty. Ate some pork cheek sammy which was delish and house made potato chips that had gorgonzola, pepper and green onions. Yum! Lots of beer for cheap and they were practicing making Manhattans so we scored one for free and it was probably the best one I've ever had. Very citrusy and didn't taste like straight alcohol. I'm also a big fan of the Ante Meridian pop up here. Black truffle waffles. (insert homer simpson drooling noise) Crowd is hipster-ish but the bartenders were super nice. I liked the Boston transplant working there too. Also the bathroom was huge for a bar and had 3 stalls and was super clean. But remember- CASH ONLY

OHLr0T6mAF31tcjSskvK4w.review_text: Cool spot! Cheap drinks (relative to Los Angeles)! Makers on the rocks is $6. Tried their pork bao and it was pretty good as well but at $11 for two small bao's I'm not sure I'f ever buy them again. I'd come back! Make sure to check out the drink specials on the wall.

5O8fn99pTl2r72AfySA_9g.review_text: This was a really cool place. It's great for groups and the assortment of liquor is pretty awesome. My hubby enjoys trying various bourbons and whiskeys and he more than approved of their selection. The ambiance is pretty casual, yet I feel like everyone in the place " had it going on!" They also offer a very unique assortment of bar bites. Aside from your typical grilled chicken sandwich, the menu items were very creative and not necessarily typical of bar food. For example, I ordered these fried chicken wraps, but they were actually fried chicken wrapped in an egg roll with Asian spices. Very delicious. My husband ordered the nachos. Again, they were not tortilla chips and melted cheese...they were more like breakfast potatoes mixed with cheese, peppers, and some other stuff. Very good and interesting. Dear Mom is a little out of the way for us and requires a can ride, so I don't think it'll become our Friday night go to spot, but it will happily and excitedly return for a special occasion.

Ck1vY1icLM3X51yqr2SGWg.review_text: Made a mistake wearing a suit and had to wait about 20 mins for a drink, Friday night trying to have a good time for my friends bday... Grow a stash and wear a beanie. Slim pickings!!! 20-35 for a drink wait....

tHJyFHGH_mnBxZ7WffZlZw.review_text: I ended up at this bar on New Years Eve, which of course means it took way too long to get a drink and it was crowded.  However, that was expected and I thought the bartenders and bussers were nice.  The bussers actually asked if I was done before taking my glass away, which is always a plus!   No tanqueray (my personal favorite) but the bartender was nice enough to recommend and pour us a gin from a local distillery (209 Gin) for the well drink price ($5 i think).    They have a photobooth, but only an internet jukebox (boring in my book).  It'd be nice to see a DJ in here on the weekends. CASH ONLY, and their ATM machine was broken with no nearby ATMs.  Come prepared!   In the end, I'd try it again!

s4g5fAinKE8U84z9LfXwsA.review_text: This is my first time at dear moms and I like it so far. There is plenty of seating, and the drinks are good. The prices are average, but the overall atmosphere was really great.  They have a jukebox with a really decent music selection under the one credit plays which was a major plus.   I had the kale tacos, my goodness they were delicious! They were made just right, and had a really good spicy kick to them.  They have a great beer selection as well. So you can pair your beers to your food really well.  The bad: the service at the tables was average, the server took forever to come check on us.   That's really the only bad review I have was the slower service at the tables. The bartenders were definitely on point though.

tlY0QMQDyfjQAEwHnzvFnw.review_text: 3.5 Stars is the perfect summary for this place.  This isn't typically a place I'd go to, but I did like my experience here.  The crowd is a bit more hipster-like and the space itself is a bit on the divey side.  We had a couple of drinks (Vodka Tonics) and they were great- really tasted perfect and refreshing.  We also had their Papas Fritas, which were very good and a nice generous portion of flavorful potatoes.  Our server was very nice and attentive.  I'd go back to this place if I were in the area.  I do have to say, the Burger looks awesome...

RcG6xWQi9f5lz6XmNqBV3Q.review_text: Dear Mom,  Turn the music down.   I never thought I'd have to say that, but perhaps your hearing is shot. You know I just want to relax on a Tuesday night with friends and enjoy the wonderful pool table, over-sized Connect Four, drinks and food you've provided.   I'm very appreciative of this, I promise, along with the space to breathe. Thanks for not smothering me.  I'm thinking of moving out though. It just doesn't feel like home.   With love, Your Mission daughter

WmCkuhKALpZM60kJrbOFKQ.review_text: do not be mistaken, this is a total bro bar.  it's good if you like that sort of thing...

qPMyo8LL1wvwirF5URHzxQ.review_text: Great space and great vibe.  If you come here thinking of it as a restaurant with a full bar, you're probably going to be a bit disappointed. Really, Dear Mom is a pretty sweet bar that just happens to have some great food options. On the subject: try the chicken sandwich and the pork belly bao. Both really good, though the latter could be a bit bigger.   Missing a certain je ne se quois that's required for a 5 star rating, but for our group of 11, it made for a great night.

9fg9i7ke1NAGhf8W3e97VA.review_text: This spot was so amazing  it's hard to believe it used to be El Ricon. Looking around now you'd never guess that it used to be a dark, forgotten, shady bar with no appeal....COMPLETE TRANSFORMATION!!!!!!! You walk in to a large open area, great music playing, pool table, more open space, booths that can sit like 10 people (finally someone realized people don't always travel in packs of 4)   You stroll up to the giant U shaped bar to get a beverage that can range from a beer and a shot to a fancy pants cocktail that could impress the biggest of cocktail gurus. Not to mention the bar staff is totally awesome and friendly, giving this place a muuuuch needed neighborhood vibe.   I had actually never tried anything from Chez Spencer before (yelp elite, please don't hate me) but luckily they have a menu and a kitchen right there at Dear Mom!!! My friends and I got several appetizers to split and loved them all. I was especially happy with the slider, the mac and cheese, and the asparagus salad. It was really nice to actually have decent food while enjoying drinks.  A good reminder for all, this place does close at midnight...it will be the first stop on many of my nights out. Welcome  to the neighborhood Dear Mom!

nv8YtTruvxRwBDaDyxgGCw.review_text: Stumbled into Dear Mom on a Sunday afternoon and wound up closing the place down!!!  It was amzing!!! they have this cool concept on Sundays where a Guest chef can come in and tear up the kitchen with their skills....the food was fantastic!!!! The ladies were great, and the atmosphere was way laid back for the "City"!!!  Go MOM!!

4bmt96Q-UMZC8WzWTx8p-A.review_text: Our favorite new lunch spot!  We have been here twice, I believe they just opened this week. We were walking past and saw the chef out front, he explained the entire menu to me willing to answer any annoying question I had, and we went inside. They have done an incredible job of renovating the space. Giant wooden tables and bars, Edison bulbs hang from the ceiling they have a homey feel made modern it's really great.  Ordering You walk to a window in the back and they have two menus, the pricer menu which is their daily specials. which average about 16 dollars and are huge portions. Today was the trout, it came with spinach and was an entire trout for 16 dollars ( I did not have the trout my friend did.)  the second menu ( both are on adorable chalks boards.) Offers up french slider 9 dollars-My boyfriend had this,  a hot dog in a baguette Soy or beef with a small green salad, and fingerling potatoes 6 dollars -I had had this,  It's a steal and my favorite thing I have been looking for is a normal soy hot dog, its been so hard in sf to find one they isn't a sausage variety. This is the perfect hot dog, I believe the mustard is homemade. It's a perfect portion and high quality ingredients.  I have also tried two Mom's daily soups, yesterday was potato leek with a pepper sauce. Today was cauliflower with a crunchy Parmesan circle about the size of the bowl laying on top this added a ton of flavor and crunchiness to the soup. Both were very good.  We also tried the asparagus Salad 6, with pepper cream sauce, like a way better version of ranch served over asparagus some other littler greens served warm. Outstanding. I loved this dish.  Now for the best thing we ate, it gets better? It does! We ordered there mac and cheese. It is 5 cheeses with the same Parmesan thingy on top, in rich creamy sauce. This is the best mac and cheese I had ever had. It's creative and fresh tasting, I will be coming back and getting this often. the only downside is the serving size is kinda small so for lunch alone it's not as filling as the hot dog or slider. But I imagine it's priced the way it is because they use 5 very fancy high quality cheeses.  Also you order directly to the chef and he is the nicest guy, his food is amazing, the staff makes sure you are happy with what you have ordered, he has personally come over twice to ask we were pleased with our dishes.  Today he remembered us from yesterday, and threw in 2 free cookies. They were little sandwich cookies one vanilla and coconut with a vanilla cream and raspberry  jelly in the center. The other a chocolate cookie with peanut butter in the middle. I will now be getting the cookies every time. They are 2 dollars.  We spent about 25 today and 20 yesterday. Also pint pbr cans are only 3 dollars, coke is 1 dollar. They also threw in my coke for free today.  I think we will eat here everyday this week. I'm especially excited for Thursday it's a Fowl special. Fowl simmered for an entire day in a tomato and olive sauce. Saturday is a beef special with cheesy mashed potatoes.  If you are in the mission looking for a new great place to have a couple beers, or a fabulous meal this is your place. I debated writing this review because I'm seflish and want them to stay slow because I'm enjoying the staff interaction, but this place won't stay a secret for long it's too wonderful.

v0k97XEwlDWwUTt8M8CJ4A.review_text: Sometimes the best bars are the ones playing the angriest music.  Big, open space, some booths, a pool table (I think?), some angry metal music, but solid beer selection if you're into IPAs (who isn't?!).  Nice place to come for an evening to catch up with some friends. And they have a juke box so you can actually play whatever you want if you don't like the angry music.

jf6_EW7qBrXVKEKbrjz7jw.review_text: Great place to get your hipster on.  If you're looking particularly "Marina", be sure to steer clear, we were heckled to the point of being kicked out during our last visit.  Just the same, I'm always up for a Dear Mom night.

Dsn0E5ad3oom8iGIrFXPsQ.review_text: Dear Dear Mom,  What.  The.  Hell.   I was kind of excited to come here. For what feels like the first time ever, a majority of Yelp reviews mislead me... Or was it an early April fools? I don't know why everyone is giving this place 4 or 5 stars. In my book, to receive 3+ stars you should at least learn to do some--NO, ALL of the following:  1. Learn how to make a proper Old Fashioned cocktail. Not one that is clearly 90% club soda and sugar. It's not hard to please alcoholics!  2. Don't charge $15+ for "French food" that is way over-salted. Was that lamb cheek polenta you served me or an actual salt lick?  3. I don't know if you're just trying to be assholes on purpose, but who serves hot dogs and doesn't provide ketchup? The guy working in the kitchen said, "Oh, we don't even have ketchup in the building..." and then maliciously rubbed his hands together and laughed in my face.   Disclaimer: Ok he didn't, but he might as well have. Actually, the guy was kind of nice and felt bad (maybe embarrassed) they didn't carry simple every day condiments.  4. Putting a hot dog in a french baguette and charging $7 felt like being robbed. Good thing we already felt robbed earlier when paying for watered down drinks so we were already familiar...  5. Don't open a bar with food and not hire a single soul to bus tables. Sitting next to 10 empty glasses and a plate of leftover salt lick isn't really the ambiance I was expecting.  1 star for the jukebox. Which had Hall and Oates. AKA a bar staple.

fh5C2dLPt0m6AITsZnkVyA.review_text: Hipsters to my left, my right, front, and back. It was fun. I think they are also cash only? (not to sure about this). But i do remember the huge tables, huge awesome jukebox, foosball and photobooth. All the things you need for a night out.

i0C4bhHjTVaAMKvz6G7fOw.review_text: Still need to eat here, but the drinks, games and juke box will bring me back. The bar was a bit crowded but I didn't have any trouble getting a drink on an especially packed night.

9WzUerODzyYUkQO0u3Nyjg.review_text: Chill bar, good music.  Food on the menu sounds interesting, almost like something off of a food truck.  Too bad we've already had food prior to this, but I would want to try next time.    Very spacious, and good for a group of friends.  $5 for beers on tap.  The only bad part - cash only.

sMfAazU842DN6NNTC7PUuQ.review_text: Great bar with a unique food selection. I've heard they occasionally host a pop-up restaurant here or there, but never been on one of those nights. Lots of seating. Large wooden table that you can take over with a big group.

7tr0p8KS1pb8qtfZAdqh-g.review_text: I love this bar!  Cash ONLY folks so make sure you bring it!  Lot's of space and nice bartenders.  It definitely fills up on Friday and Saturday nights.

4t3t5fE3umHifiMq77knNA.review_text: Very nice place, but ruined by one solitary employee.      I went here for my first time last night, and enjoyed the guest food they were serving (which is a FANTASTIC idea) as well as the above average selection of beers they had. I was still on my first beverage (a phenomenal Peach Cider from Dogfish Head Brewery) when 1145 rolled around and a bartender shouted that we had ten minutes to all get out. My group, which consisted of 5 people, were all surprised at this, but took note of it nonetheless. Most of us, including myself, are servers and completely understand what it's like to want the last few people out when you're trying to close up. There were only a couple other people at the bar, so we were concentrating on finishing our beverages.     A couple of minutes later, a young woman came up to the table to take what she could, and specifically told me that "I need that, too", referring to my 2/3 full pint. I said "ok, not yet though"...which seemed rather obvious to me. I proceeded to drink it as fast as I could without feeling a little ill, and a few minutes later she came back to the table and took everyone else's cans, then stared at me. Acknowledging her impatience, I said "I'm guzzling as fast as I can." and took another drink. She stood right next to where I was sitting and insisted "No, I really need it now." I then said to her that we heard them say we had ten minutes before we had to leave (which, may I add, is pretty short notice), to which she replied "Yes, and that was 8 minutes ago."  "O.K.", I said, "let me just drink this, then."     At that point, as if her aggressive presence and proximity to my person weren't enough, she said "Oh my God, I am NOT having this conversation with you!" and kept staring with her hand lingering as close as possible to my glass. I merely said to her "Then don't. Let me drink my drink." I took one more drink before she actually grabbed it out of my hand and stormed away. I didn't resist her, because I was too busy wondering how in the world someone thinks it's ok to treat a guest like that at an establishment. In my many years in the service industry, as well as many years frequenting bars, I've never experienced such rude and awkward behavior from an employee.     I had been planning to go back to this bar because I enjoyed the atmosphere as well as its selection. Unfortunately though, I can't overlook such mistreatment, and will take my business elsewhere.      I can't say I don't recommend this place, but when you go, try to avoid a twenty-something-ish African American girl with shoulder length curly hair. Especially if you are one who enjoys tasting your beverages while you drink them, or being treated with respect.

SUT-5m76n0LZxnp_AL7biQ.review_text: Came here this past weekend for a friend's bday celebration. Reservations were made so that our party would have the back room, but apparently it was double booked so we had to share the room that we already knew typically gets hot. Food was decent, but nothing to write home about.   The worst part was the service of the bartender (blonde woman). She had a bad attitude, sarcastic and was rude. She then complained about a bad tip from my friend when I ordered and that just made it worse. We are usually very generous when we tip, but not when the service is this bad.  With so many other places in SF that give great service, do yourself a favor and skip this place.

cnUg80v3CcNki6n-rQrWmw.review_text: Dear Mom came recommended from a few friends, but it's just not my taste. It was excruciatingly hipster. There are so many dive bars with real people and cheap drinks in the mission. It's like people come here to avoid realness. Or maybe for the food - the food did look good.  There's lots of space, booths, communal tables, and games (it's just like your start up office!).   The music was loud as hell, which made it hard to have a conversation. The night I went in everyone was playing 90s hip hop on the jukebox - cool, but I don't want to watch SF hipsters who think they can dance. That's not your jam, clearly.  The drinks aren't cheap either - $20 for a cocktail and a beer. And cash only.  Three stars because really, it's not a bad place, it's just...meh and annoying to me.

-iiuT7X9wG37wGTxcsnklQ.review_text: I actually don't enjoy going to bars because a) I think alcohol is bitter and b) I'm not too enthused about being in crowded areas with drunk people. However, I came here with a large group of people and was happy that we were able to sit in their back room which was large enough to hold 20 people comfortably. It felt more like a lounge than a club. When we left and had to walk through the more crowded area was annoying though with sweaty people trying to flirt.  The drawbacks of this place would have to be thee bathroom. The women's restroom is pretty awkward. The toilets are separated by (for lack of better terms) shower curtain-esque cloth. Fortunately there is a main door to the bathroom so if you're fearful of someone opening the curtain while you're doing your business you can lock the REAL door. Another disturbing part of the bathroom are the photos of people tacked to the wall. I feel like I'm walking into a scary movie. The pictures on the wall, dim lights and awkward shower curtained toilets were enough to give me the creeps.  The other drawback was the menu. Granted, it did say slider on the menu (note the singular form here) but honestly, when I think of bar food I would have expected sliderS! My friend and I paid $9 thinking we could share, but we ended up getting a slider and a small salad. Granted, the slider was tasty, but for $9 it was a bit of a rip off.

cCPjASKs5YpMB4BmN2oSZg.review_text: Good recommendation for tall beers and big burgers. Dear Mom offers plenty of room for both. Despite all of the burger "research," I go there to drink. Once you get service, the alcohol will be strong, and cheap if you get one of their specials.   I ate two burgers there: the Angus and the chorizo. The Angus was good though the chorizo was a bit better. The latter is more moist, aided by a fried egg. Each burger comes with huge potato chunks, like Epic, not regular fries. You can fill up these if you aren't careful.   Day or night, and by day I mean after the SF Marathon, the music will be a good mix of your old favorites. Sometimes you'll pick up a theme, sometimes you'll just want to dance in your seat a bit.   Mixed diet crowds will like the menu because vegetarian dishes make up a good percentage of the menu.  The guys on the grill are nice and work their tails off. The other folks there are definitely nice but not fast. More slow service means drinks and food won't arrive as quickly as they should though, regardless of bar or table seating.

2Qfa3o72sq04_MCUxy3Shg.review_text: OH. OHHHH BOY.  This bar is RAD.   Goddamn it I love the (former) Thieves crew. So much.   Get the raspberry Liefmans. Thank me (actually thank the bartender who gave it to my roommate who gave it to me) later.  Kinda creeped by the bathroom situation. But the music ROCKS.  Did I mention its HUGE? (No probably not cus I was too busy sippin raspberry beer and dancing in my booth to the awesome music.) BUT IT IS. Bring all your friends. Take 5 dollar shots with a PBR and sing your night away!

6qRwXIHd30vwBijjOVFVeQ.review_text: Came here randomly with a few friends recently, mostly because it was the closest bar to us and we were trying to escape a storm. None of us had been here before, and weren't aware that it was cash-only. To top it off, the ATM was broken. We pooled together our cash, and came up with a measly $5. I sheepishly went up to the bartender and asked what we could get for that much. Taking pity (perhaps it was the helpless wet dog chic look...), he offered to make the cocktail I was originally intending to order. He asked how many of us were splitting it, and I said three. Not only did he make the cocktail...he made two additional ones, all for $5! We couldn't even tip him, so I felt really bad, but his level of service was definitely appreciated by all of us. We will be going back for sure (with cash money), and will pay a fatty tip next time!  Other than awesome bartenders, the music was great and it was a really chill place, and easy to talk amongst our small (and poor) group.

E6cw3Hd-xB05ghEr3_0zRw.review_text: It's big.  It's open.  It's fun.  It's festive.  It's everything you'd want in a bar if you're not a pretentious jerk.

rnLazkgHW1cUqu240A2XmQ.review_text: Picked Dear Mom as the place to go for celebrating my birthday with friends.  We knew ahead of time the bathroom situation may be a bit of an adventure - and on that front, happy to say the strange partitions have been replaced with shower curtains.  Yes - still a bit odd, but for the most part, offer reasonable privacy.  On to the drinks... The "special" cocktails were unfortunately terrible.  I ordered an old fashioned and was surprised to get a glass filled to the brim with ice and soda water (oh, and some whiskey and an orange peel).  Maybe they need a review on the definition of a "splash" of water?  Needless to say - don't put the drink on your "specials" board if you don't know how to make a proper old fashioned.  My friend also ordered a drink from the "specials" - no bueno.    Good news is that it seems if you stick with something simple (gin and soda... whiskey and ginger...) you'll be far more pleased.  And the beer and wine is quite reasonble (after the old fashioned fiasco - I stuck with wine).  The food = meh.  Wasn't amazing and wasn't cheap.  Kudos to not just having fries, but if you're going to charge $10 for a small side of "4 Cheese Farfalle" (aka mac & cheese) - please just add a bit more flavor... maybe throw in some gruyere or even some herbs.  The best part about the places is really just the space.  It's big - it's open - it has a great feel!  Best to go, grab an beer or wine - and pick a song on the jukebox.

REGjppkq2IkDLRQVmRj_Bg.review_text: Dearm mom,  Oh how I've missed you!  This place is a welcomed addition to the edge of the Mission.  With a pool table, digital jukebox, private "dining" room in the back and a bar that's always hopping, Dear Mom is sure to keep the party going.  The food menu looks delicious and what more could you want from a drunken night/day of debauchery? Imagine if you will Zeitgeist having a bit more refinement without being stuffy or unassuming of anyone who enters.  The crowd is mixed for sure with hooligans and professionals alike.  Grab a beer or some hard liquor and make the night memorable.

y_jl-bErj1mnb4KF04F74Q.review_text: We went because the burger was on a 'top SF burger' list. Our group was disappointed: dry, no additional topping options (such as cheese, bacon, onions). The bun was good, but it stops there. Tator tots served with it - boring.  The bartender service was friendly and good.   The music was cranked up really loud about 30 minutes into our stay.

Bd8V3uFgfhY28pqR0WQy7A.review_text: I moved to San Francisco about a year and a half ago.  As an avid and good eater one of the first new dining experiences one has to embrace upon moving to this food utopia, is that of the food truck.    I experienced for a good part of the first six months of my time here with various food trucks and the madhouse that is Off the Grid.  But it wasn't until I found Fogcutter that I found my favorite.    Fogcutter was, in my opinion, the BEST food truck San Francisco had to offer.   They served up a Californian spin on Mexican fusion of delicious tortas.  The best thing to boot, was that Fogcuter would be conveniently parked outside my favorite Mission coffee hole on Saturday or Sunday mornings, meaning I always had a convenient and tasty brunch option.  Nowadays, Fogcutter has a permanent home as the resident restaurant inside Dear Mom.  I've been twice since their move and while the menu is different, it is still AMAZING.  The hamburger I had last night was honestly one of the best freakin burgers I've ever had.  It had all the fixins complete with America's new burger sensation the fried egg...LOVE IT.  The time before I had the fried chicken bao, a great and flavorful chinese style bun with fried chicken and cabbage.    This place is the bomb, and you should all go.  As it now has a permanent home, I'll be there all the time!

QufLijljxuxJquyFg4DOgA.review_text: Pretty bad experience.  A friend of mine made a reservation a week in advance for his birthday (in person, no less), for ~25 people, was told he'd have the back room, and was also told he'd get a phone call to confirm.  No phone call, and repeated calls to the bar over the next week resulted only in an answering machine (which they apparently don't listen to).  We arrive at the appointed time, and... what do you know, they've "lost" the reservation, and grudgingly give us a small, crappy table crammed in a corner with only two chairs, after which they proceed to completely ignore us.  We lucked into a booth when another party left (a good half hour later), and once a critical mass of our group had arrived, we left en masse.  Aside from that, drinks were poorly mixed: two friends had a terrible Old Fashioned and an abhorrent Manhattan, respectively, and somehow the bartender even managed to make my gin and tonic taste... weird.  Didn't bother to try the food.  Not much to recommend here.

tV27p1gguxWbWQfH_VjzNQ.review_text: I could easily rate this place 5 stars. The Jameson and PBR $7 special was right on the money. The atmosphere was definitely trashy enough, only lacking a slight touch of class. It's definitely a place to get wasted, which warrants a few stars on my yelp page.  The negatives include a busted ATM and chasing down the bartenders for my drink. I am not accustomed to either and both would've had me heading for the door if I wasn't there for a special occasion.

rcmCREatKyxozZXQsEv1YA.review_text: 2.5 stars.  Although the food looked good, the drinks were not.  Also, the waitstaff and bartenders were rude throughout the night (kicking us out of a table because they didn't understand that we were the ones who had reserved them and then not apologizing when corrected, bartenders refusing to give us water when the single pitcher in the corner was empty, etc.)

IPYIi9LH0zddqKEscbDjYg.review_text: Loved the anthony yang brunch popup. We tried the rice porridge with pork, spinach creme, poached egg  and and kimchee. Great breakfast food. Also the beef fat toasted bagel, not really toasted far as i could tell. Anyway, the smoked sturgeon cream cheese was fab, not very cheesy, and very thinly sliced cucumber and charred scallion atop.yummy! Also enjoyed the slow scrambled eggs with fried oysters, three, spinach and lardons.  We def needed three items to fill the two of us. Only real knock was the bar. One bartender can't fill orders for 25-50 people, at least this one. Tried to order but wasted my time. Food came and i gave up. . Prices were $9-12/per item for the food. Dark and hipster inside, I'd like to see what anthony yang would do with his own restaurant.

LU7ikPXZ5R8tv4oNQZQkKw.review_text: Cool bar with a weekly pop up.

2XgvN35TRQdFsYV0njVM6A.review_text: Still a great place to get a drink, drinks are still pretty darn affordable.... I love that they take card now so more of my money goes down the drain.  But what the hell happened to the damn food menu?  It's full of a bunch of healthy crap?  What happened to the tater tots or the tacos?? And what happened to the burger?? a slice of lettuce as extra?  Don't get me wrong the patty is still good, but no bacon? No tomatos? pickles? onions?  As for food, this place has taken a big dip, maybe its because to satisfy all the lame hipsters that go here?  change your food menu back to something that taste better... after a days work, I ain't trying to go to a bar and eat wood chips and kale.

4odC28scHx_y9URM0_1wyw.review_text: HU-MUNG-GO!   Really great space and things that they've filled it with - the giant wooden table at the front and all the booths and the table at the back.    I like the horseshoe bar seating.    I like the variety of beers they have.    They have good snacky food - and I feared that they might not have anything veegs but they do!  Way better than the creepy places that have been at this location in the past - meaning NOT CREEPY at all - super great!  One thing I think they should do is add more bartenders on the bar.   It's a really big bar and having just one person doing it all is too much crazy for that one person and too much waiting for me.   I think of places like Thee Parkside that has a fairly small seated bar and will put 2/3 on to work it and they sell drinks non-stop. I think if they added more people on the bar people would buy more drinks and they would make more cash for the place and more tips for themselves and I would think I had died and gone to bar heaven!

e6QRXwwzhebaLVX0JEztpg.review_text: Overall no strong feelings about Dear Mom - except that my friends and I had a lot of fun with the photo booth in the corner.  Although, being the practical one, I couldn't quite figure out why we paid like $30 for low-quality B&W photos when I had my digital camera right there... but, the girls loved it, and happy girls means happy Greg.

8nqcdY9b-zolA3DgfeHSxw.review_text: I have to say, I was disappointed by Dear Mom, because at first glance there is so much potential.  The bar is large, generally has a good divey or local feel, but it was so crowded and impossible to walk that it was hard to enjoy.  The ping pong was a nice touch, but the general inability to maneuver made it feel more like a club than a bar.

Obc-VP99cOlLa0Z0tG_BPQ.review_text: 5 stars for bomb service!  Hosted a small, work-related happy hour here last week, and the folks at Dear Mom could not have been more helpful.  I called to see if they could give us a deal on drinks.  When you call about an event, what happens is this:  -You leave a message on their answering machine. -The manager calls you back in about 10 minutes and offers your group a sweet drink special. -You can communicate with the manager via text from then on.  Why isn't it this easy everywhere?  When we got to the bar, the bartender (I'm bad with names, but going to go with Robert?) was awesome and set up tables for us in the back room, even though I hadn't reserved the space.  He came by mid-way through the evening to make sure everything was ok, and didn't seem to care that we weren't spending a ton of money.  (We all work for non-profits ;)  The man also makes a mean hot toddy.  Probably helped that it was a Tuesday night, but nonetheless: Dear Mom comes HIGHLY recommended, as a casual, after-work happy hour spot.

_tHjjf_pvM7i0QALYsKxdQ.review_text: I love Dear Mom. I go out a lot with a big group of friends, and Dear Mom is one of the only bars that can hold us all!  They have a great PB&J special, $7 for a tall PBR and a shot of Jameson. They also have really good bloody marys here.   The food is great, the baguette hot dogs and the soup are my favorite.   I dig the jukebox and the photobooth! We hit it up every time we stop by.

ZLVaLX6E4olh6h5o6ihjLA.review_text: I'm going to review Dear Mom from a single person's perspective and then my own.  Single perspective: the drinks are stiff and the clientele is attractive. SOLD!  Me: it's too loud to carry on a real conversation, sometimes the bartenders can't keep up with orders (not their fault), the bathrooms are clean, the beer list could be better BUT you can always find parking within a block. SOLD!

xNIFzp7I9v6XEkIgjvavEA.review_text: As a bar, this place is pretty cool. There's a pool table, booths, lots of open space, and decent beer selection. But I would NOT recommend eating here. The food is very lackluster for the price and you'd be lucky to find a place to sit down and actually be able to have a conversation with the people you're with.

vjWMqGJ9bJpUQ_1t44IuTQ.review_text: Dear Mom,  You know how we have that never-ending quest for that perfect bar with great food? This place isn't quite it, but it's damn close.  It used to be this really run-down dive bar but they've gutted the place and now it's nice and comfortable. Big and spacious, plenty of seating (even a huge table with benches on all four sides if you've got 12 or so with you), natural wood everywhere...  Decent beer selection, and the bar looked pretty stocked. Custom cocktail menu, changed frequently.  And oh, the food. Papas fritas with cotija cheese/tapatio aioli/cilantro, deviled eggs with salmon roe and togarashi, pork belly bao with bean sprouts and peanuts... they change it frequently and it's all good.  In short, Mom, we'll be coming here next time you visit.  Love, Sam

rbg0gOdbEZwmLW1H9mWBGg.review_text: I am honestly surprised that the food here is really really good. I ordered 'The Burger' and wow, that was a good burger. Large patty cooked just right with a good selection of toppings with a side of awesome fried potato wedges. One bite and I was sold. The burger was juicy and deliciousness.  My friends also ordered the Fried Chicken Bao's. Also an excellent choice full of flavour and crunch.  It got pretty crowded and it was hard to find a table for our large group. It felt like a bar/club/lounge/diner. We had a great time. Definitely order food when you get here!

W9RU376D6Ny0GzFKtc7uNQ.review_text: Tall cans of PBR everywhere. Been here a couple times, but this past time, I came for Pop Up (where chefs come and cook their specialties). Cool venue that hosts cool events (like Pop Up and Berlin style ping pong). They also have a fooseball table.

5jLkKtE4HPlrbjw-0w9lvg.review_text: A cool bar with a good beer selection, but the Hella Vegan Eats brunch, lunch, and dinner pop-ups are really where it's at. Dear Mom's has other food pop-ups too, but how can you say no to a donut burger and a pint?

XHuNSjrPA3Vyi7n4iVhZaQ.review_text: I'm much too old for this shit.   Brunch was not good, drinks were just okay, crowd was cliqueish and strange, and cash only? You can't get yourself a square account?   That being said, there's not much else out here. Maybe I'd stop in for a shot under duress.

CQ8OSQFPCCoo0ujxEyEVRA.review_text: I had been meaning to check out Dear Mom for quite some time and finally made it last Saturday. The style and decor is simplistic and perfect for the hipster crowds of the mission. I love the communal tables as they are great for large groups. While it's nice to actually have a place in the Mission that will accomodate a big party, I think the size of dear mom takes away from the bar. Everyone is largely engaged with their own groups and physically quite far from others despite it being a busy weekend.   I was a little disappointed by the cocktails. I suppose I was expecting speakeasy style craft cocktails so maybe I was wrong for going in with that expectation. On the other hand, they did have a decent beer selection.  To be fair, I'll probably return to Dear Mom when I want some one-on-one time with a friend over a drink but may opt for other bars with a little more personality for later in the night.

Oyi2vE1-zrCT4IUbXMuzQA.review_text: The bartenders here are really hot and really nice. One of the tall hot brunette bartenders even gave me Lisa Frank stickers.

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: Smart lady.  Perhaps it was a special. Or perhaps Dear Mom is super special for offering vodka tonics for only $5 on a Saturday night.   For all the reasons in first two reviews they get four star stars. For this reason in my third review Mom gets a fifth.  Smart choice.

ZDnwnGRhpflkAqwehZADZQ.review_text: Ok, this place has a good space but they have the worst service ever. Most asshole bartenders there are! They have really good potatoes with super good sauce. Definitely say wassup with those! I also recommend the Pilsner Bulleit combo. It's where the money's at! Seriously though, I've had a bartender that has refused to serve me, and several that have yelled at me for minor stuff. Some of them are cool, but the majority that I've dealed with are way too high strung. Super hard to find a table if you are coming with a crew, too. Don't count on being able to hang out with a crowd larger than four.

AetbB5SON94n7Yy-dZiZOQ.review_text: I like straight forward establishments like this. "This is what we have and do. Like it or don't" is in the air. Grab a beer and have a seat.   They have a large and worldly beer selection and the staff is knowledgeable.   However, according to the internet they have a large Connect 4 game (nerd alert!) They do not any longer I'm sad to report.

p1BSvgmuGZuDg3xPnzwUww.review_text: Nice place... Friendly bartenders and some unexpectedly good French influenced food.

XFFCSts3EYKwSZdHZQ4wew.review_text: After years of only reading other yelp reviews, I signed up for an account today simply because I loved Dear Mom so so much! Went last night and was overwhelmed by the friendliness of Oliver and his staff. This will certainly be a regular spot for me. Can't wait to get back soon and sip delicious drinks in a fun atmosphere while visiting with Oliver. He's so great!

YFZLBlnojAFjdii1ufdNXA.review_text: this place was surprising.  kind of in the middle of nowhere, but at least there is plenty of parking around.  it took me a few to get oriented, as there is no drink menu save the beer list on a chalkboard near the ceiling that i could barely read.  i wasn't feeling like beer, and i don't like trying to invent my own cocktails.  so i just asked the bartender to make something involving bourbon.  whatever she made was amazing.   she explained to me what it was: bourbon, lime, and honey, i believe.  there may have been some other ingredients, but that captures the essence of it.  One of the best cocktails i've ever had.  Plus she was generous with the alcohol.  After drinking half of it, I was seriously buzzing.  But still I went back for another.  The also serve some small plates.  We got mac n' cheese, the baked hot dog and shrimp and grits.  All of it was surprisingly good for a place in the Mission/Potrero nether world.  I definitely think the mac n' cheese was the best.  I generally don't get mac n' cheese at restaurants because it never tastes as exciting as it sounds, but this place got the job done.  Also I found it unpretentious in general.

DUixVL_rtpaMl-PruJEzZQ.review_text: I was there on their opening night and I hope they do really well.  Great vibe, nice people, flash space (think dark warehouse with iron and muted cements, an irreverent giant game of Connect Four and a ping pong table in the back.  Their food was terrific, and they hadn't gotten their sellers license yet - so had to give all the food and drink away to a thrilled crowd - and here's the clincher - they seemed utterly unpained to do so.  Like someone before me wrote, the Thieves Tavern crew is hard not to love, and so is Dear Mom, their new joint.  It's slightly off the beaten path (though 16th is a huge main drag in SF, and Treat Street, the cross street, is really not that far from the Mission), but that'll keep it from ever getting douchy.  I'll definitely be back.

7At-2aosTzh6pJcQyMrubA.review_text: Very cold...shut the door already! Like it enough, neighborhood bar, right around my office. Good value, happy hour $4/well, & $5/premium! Food... but limited menu. Shrimp & grits are bland, asparagus is savory, sliders...meh.

oPe4O-S8FmKgjHwbciEH2Q.review_text: Pros: good food at great prices.  Sriracha burger is tasty but on the spicy side...actually tastes more like a buffalo chicken burger.  Char su bao-like creation is very tasty, but wish it came in a 3 pack vs 2.   Cons: not being a hipster, felt slightly intimidated.  Buck hunter shotgun doesn't reload that well.

TkqX-ROO2Lcujp0iTowP9w.review_text: This place used to be one of my favorite bars. It was a great combo of good beer selection, a full bar, and incredibly tasty pub grub like carnitas tacos and papas fritas. For some reason the menu has changed drastically and gone too upscale for this place. The prices went up and the food quality went wayyy down.  Without that fantastic bar menu, this place is just another middling bar with a decent beer list. Those bars are a dime a dozen in this town. Guess I'll be heading back over to the Sycamore for now...  PLEASE bring back the old menu!

iTfXuRhOQ-SgEVoIuRy-yQ.review_text: This bar felt like some awful purgatory where 30something yuppies go when they're too groomed and wealthy to go to the bars they used to go to but aren't ready to admit that their partying days are over. i don't plan on returning...

yYjPSau4U6eXG2S6Qt6NmQ.review_text: Service SUCKED. 15-25 mins waiting on each drink no good. Each bartender charges differently for the same drink. Black chick w/ snake pants seemed to charge more. 3 shots of Jameson is 18. She charged 21. A can of PBR is $3. She charged $4. Asked why N she said cause its 8. Got there at 11. What really bothered me is I gave her $5 bill for the $4 PBR and she put my $1 change in the tip bucket. She noticed I was waiting for my change so she took $1 out the register and gave it to me. Stealing.

tGgTIueZy1JNTzQD9rkZLQ.review_text: 02.02.12 || bookmarked 12.21.11  It's Thursday at 8.  We were a few drinks in from happy hour.  We had this place in mind to meet a bigger group.  I was hungry.  They serve food!  Yay yay!  Potato leek soup + asparagus salad to the rescue.  $12.  Cash only.  ATM to the left of the entrance next to the neon colored jukebox.  Foosball table eats quarters.  Did not spit out balls.  Boohoo.  Drank beer that I couldn't pronounce.  Wish I could remember more.  Left three hours later.  Where did all our cash go?

dVpYTO1J8ipOCgVAzU5-lA.review_text: I love this bar, lot of place, and good american food.

vD65y5E3Az3bFc6UW4G1eA.review_text: Nice spot, but the cash only thing always does irk me.  We came here after starting the day at Zeitgeist, and this spot has quite the impressive bar menu.  We had a sampling of food, which was good, and if in the area again, I would snack here.  - Pork Belly Bao: A little asian goodness with some slaw. Definitely an upgrade from the $.80 one in Chinatown. But I get it, the $9 version is much fancier. - Papas Fritas: Fancy pants fries with cheese. Yum. - Tacos Camones: Fresh, light, and pretty good.  All in all, this place is good.  While the cash factor is bummer, its a good spot for a quick bite. Its knocked down to three stars only bc of the cash only deal.

AJYM2G-iFT6oDVwAbRYhGg.review_text: Dear Mom did its job, and did it well. Can I see us getting close and perhaps having impromptu rendezvous? Naa, but a cool place on a Friday night none the less. The bar was pretty full yet the bartenders were keeping everyone happy!

SJ5nSicfp9DsWk6npyEl4A.review_text: Pros: A *lot* of floorspace so you're not all up in everyone's grill. Also I didn't try the food but it seemed to be a pop-up-y sort of indie fusion thing that warmed my foodie-hipster heart.  Cons: I got really excited when I saw the racks of delectable-looking brown-colored alcohols on the wall and ordered an old fashioned. Sadly, it seems to be a bait-and-switch sort of setup, because what I got was easily the WORST such cocktail I've ever had. It tasted like watery whiskey, bitters, and nothing else. Everyone at my table agreed that it was terrible. I might expect that from an open bar at a cheap wedding, but a hispterriffic bar with more bourbon bottles on the wall than distressed-wood paneling? I expected far more of you.

fHnAHkd0rNscAXlWpy7M9Q.review_text: Hipster Nation Babaaay  Haha that's the first thing that comes to mind. I saw a guy from the Real World here last time I went, so I guess it's popular enough? There's plenty of standing room. There's some game machines / photobooths in the back and seemed to be where everyone wanted to congregate.  Aside from that, I think it's a little too far off the regular Mission for a leisurely stroll. Plan accordingly.

2iHZ1h1rDds2iw-_1iDJlA.review_text: Great layout, 4 foot connect-four,  and earnest bartending - you should absolutely bring your friends to this gem in the Mission.   Only 6 weeks old so you can be the first to know about Dear Mom

cDlnwHPRkqITteeqANH2zg.review_text: I just got done snackin HARD on the burger here. Truth is, this is the third night in a row I have been here. Internet at home is down and I have a lot of work to do in the next week, so I searched for places in the Mission (close to BART) to go to after my day job where I could be comfortable, go late night, grab some food, grab a beer and use free wifi.  Dear Mom ended up to be the place, I am now a super fan.   Hipster? Fine, I can see why, but I don't see that implemented here in the negative sense. I mean everyone and everything under 35 yrs old is pretty much hipster these days in some way or another.  Live in Williamsburg, NY and you will see why hipster became a dirty word.  People at Dear Mom are really friendly. The bartenders helped me find an outlet for my comp and one moved a beer when he saw it close enough to do damage if spilled. Everyone I have encountered have been really warm, nice and helpful.  I have had their papas fritas and the burger.  Holy shit their burger is so good, best I've had in awhile. Pink in the middle, pickles and white sharp cheddar. um...yeah.  Now, five stars is like the perfect score. There is one thing I don't like.  The music is deafening. It is a bar, so I don't expect it to be a quiet cafe, it doesn't need to be quiet at all. I actually think most bars should turn their music down. Everyone shouts over it and I feel like I'm damaging my ears and my voice box at the same time.  Anyhoo, I gave them five anyway because they have saved me and made my long work week really pleasant.   Oh, and I love their layout, it can fit a lot of people. I have so far been able to find a seat away from the crowd each time I come.

6H_dtENKchTvC80Uacepzg.review_text: I was not able to attend a co-worker's going away, since I live in another city many, many miles away, so I emailed the folks at Dear Mom to coordinate buying a round of drinks for my team. Apparently, they are not set up to accept credit cards, so a very nice gentleman phoned me to let me know that because they thought I was attempting to make a nice gesture, they would COMP a drink to anyone who said my name. Have you ever heard of such a thing?!!! I have not. And we were expecting about 15 people to attend...  I am still floored by their generosity. I'll be brining my business to this business next time I'm in SF. You can count on it.   Dear Mom, thanks for being so thoughtful and considerate!

5qgJTus1l35A6bqW2fFk0w.review_text: A more up-scale divey bar in the Mission that has a pretty good scene on the weekends.  Nothing too special but decent beer selection and a very casual atmosphere.  Cash only.

tD1a0zdA1UvjBIH7vHKK3w.review_text: I'll admit it- I rolled my eyes when my friends wanted to go to the Mission for drinks. I can't take the surly bartenders, the entitled tech geeks, etc. Wound up picking this place since we had a few vegans in the group and they have vegan options on their bar bites menu.   The bartender was really nice and attentive. She also put credits in the jukebox which I love. I was with a group but probably would have sat at the bar if i was not. Also the food was really good! We had lemon-sesame edamame, and papas fritas. My co-workers had the fried chicken bun, and a burger and raved about both.  I would totally come back here, and they're really close to BART.

Plba67hIC8cVnBjz0tpymQ.review_text: 'a bar with a kitchen, and not the other way around.'

vjKo265gMl01lhqg8fCylA.review_text: Don't recall having a fried chicken bao, but it was awesome. As is the kitchen in general. I don't see how you can go wrong. Given the place looks like a giant dive bar, it's easy to miss how good the food is.  Along with great food, there's a great selection of beer and hard stuff. There's even some local distillations available, such as Old Potrero Rye. Nice to try something new and local.

qc2NbphhxhWcwn_J-x-Pqw.review_text: Dear mom.... (better known as "dear god don't go here").  Where shall I start? We came here for the pop up sushi and what was promised to be a good experience. We left feeling like I'd had a meal at the Hilton Guantanamo bay.  The pop up sushi was good. But the bar girl (dark hair and wearing blue tonight) clearly was trained by Kim Jong Il.  She was rude, obnoxious and offensive. I won't waste words on her and her abysmal and complete outright rude behavior. It's best I forget people can behave like that.  Our second bar tender (the tall guy with beard) was amazing. He was knowledgeable and courteous but due to general Pinochet (aka bitch in blue) we skimped on your tip. I feel bad for this because he was such a great guy.... but by now we'd all had enough.  Add to that the last server (the OTHER dark haired female bartender) asking us to move and then adding "I didn't want to throw you out your seats".... Well... Uhm.... Clearly you need to be educated. Asking us to move OFF the bar when there is ample room cannot in ANYWAY be construed as making us vacate our seats. Unless ... Wait.... You are dumb. Clearly you are.  The sushi was good. The bar and staff ..... Sorry... They were abysmal. The staff make you wonder if they were trained by forest gump. Wait... He has manners.

eYFvWSniiwPMrqlF8R9fiQ.review_text: I want this place to be good but it's just not. It seems to have everything you'd want, full bar, big space, kitchen, brews on tap but the  crowd is a little weird, cocktails are horrible and the food is even worse. I kept thinking I had just ordered the wrong thing off the menu or ordered from the wrong bartender but nope, it disappoints every time. Whatever you're looking for or hoping dear mom to be it just won't meet your expectations. In a city like sf there are so many better options.

drI9J9xeWephVGlfMC487w.review_text: After months of plotting, I finally made it to Dear Mom. It's kind of an akward location, unless you happen to live in one of the lofts or condos nearby. I don't. But when I finally had a couple of hours to kill before going out with friends, it was time. It was pretty empty when I was there, close to opening, so I got to really observe. It's a terrific spot for a group. They have several very large tables wnd alot ot seatng around the bar. There are also various amusements like a Simpsons pinball machine and a room dedicated to table tennis. They have food, too. The menu is somewhat eclectic, but you can probably find something. I tried the bao, and they were delicious. I just had a beer, so I can't comment on the cocktails. The staff was friendly, if a bit distracted. I liked the vibe enough that I want to go back sometime, hopefully when the place is bustling.

fuwIz5sJlCwG_gSRSbk8IQ.review_text: I love this bar. It has a nice dive bar atmosphere, with great contemporary american food. I love the eggs on eggs (deviled). They have a great on tap and bottle/can selection, plus a very full liquor selection. I'm not sure if they have wine, but this isn't the type of place you'd order wine. It can get crowded, but I've defiantly filled out a booth and met some cool people.

ilesK4CRarjiblkxUDL_tQ.review_text: I think this place is really awesome! I came here on a date with my husband and had a great time. For a bar, the food was pretty good and the drinks were excellent! I love the vibe and atmosphere of Dear Mom, it's a great place for small and big gatherings!

kOVxC6FyaxQdxkhsztnd7Q.review_text: Really cool place for the neighborhood. It's got kind of a biker bar feel inside. Every couple of weeks the chefs change and they get a whole new menu. It's a really amazing way for young talented chefs to showcase their cooking. I went this weekend for brunch with a few friends and everything we tried was amazing. I know that they're open late as well and they have a full bar but I can't really comment much on that.  Only complaint I have is that it's cash only but at least there's an ATM inside!

q16FcvZyP5SURJEX8iGcTg.review_text: This place definitely has a hipster vibe! I came to meet a friend around 5pm on a Monday so it wasn't as crowded.  The place itself looks relatively clean, but the back table we sat at had a horrible smell of vomit.  I don't know how else to describe it.  Plus it was warm outside, so the smell was really gross  I wouldn't come back unless a close friend really, really, really wants to have a drink here.   They don't accept American Express.

ZQ4_ofeB5WT-5F3szISbXA.review_text: So... decent place, but when a member of our party (who none of us knew) argued with the bouncer, all of our drinks were picked up off the table and taken away. When I tried to talk to the bartender about it, she stuck behind her busser and refused to replace/refund/apologize. Not really cool. Not a nice attitude. Not going back.

V3kb9duvevsDAx3WQdvk1g.review_text: I had been counting the days for this place to open as I'm a big fan of Jay's from the Thieves Tavern days. Cavernous, comfy, and dark, it's a locals-friendly (not gonna use the "h" word) dive bar with exceptional food. (the pop-ups vary, but this is for the regular DM menu). She ordered the angus burger w/ white cheddar and we both agreed it alone was worth the trip, I had an awesomely spicy sriracha spicy buffalo chicken sandwich: succulent with a nice even heat. Good selection of beers on tap, really more of a shot-and-a-beer place than a cocktail bar.  Only complaint: we were told dogs were not allowed because of CA health code, which is technically true. But there is -ahem- another famous bar WITH a smiliar kitchen just a short walk away on S. Van Ness that is enthusiatically dog friendly. No one's really enforcing the law and considering the giant size of the space and the proximity to both the pound AND the SPCA it's a real drag that they aren't dog-friendly.

JKgZX5ebfgy9CCzkQcpWwA.review_text: DEAR MOM is THE BEST! I love the vibe of this joint. the $4 happy hour is perfect and the food is delicious. It is even VEGAN friendly! I really can't say enough about Dear Mom!

v8JQa5Ma-n0WDLeImJN-0g.review_text: Dear mama,   You are nice and coool. Oliver is a good bartender. I like this place a lot. It is off "the strip" oops that is a las Vegas term,but I'm  sure you understand the term. Duh. Good Spot you should COME.

JycHzRPyWcAWeUrt5pPKgQ.review_text: The food has a good deal of originality and most items are very good. I particularly like the pork belly bao. Service varies depending on who is behind the bar and how crowded it is. Best server I've had: Devon. That guy hustles and still takes the time to make you feel welcome. I wish they'd rotate the taps (or add some more), but they've got some nice options.  It's a very comfortable environment.

Oxtl_KTWQOM_4WYvY7jVMw.review_text: I really like this place.  It is definitely not a happening block and the space feels big and a bit cold, but the food is really good - sort of everything you could want in SF/fancy bar food.  Drinks are good and they have lots of good beers on tap.  You can also get in and get served, which I definitely like in a bar.  They are oddly often out of things - like coke - not what I would expect for a bar.  It is also cash only which is a bit annoying when the drinks are $10.  There are not a lot of great places in this neighborhood and this one is good.  Definitely worth checking out.

IfBFgK8ZEIe3h5fBFLEJBA.review_text: Dear Mom doesn't quite live up to its original hype. Nothing wrong with it--the space is fairly big and the drinks are fairly cheap. The night I went with a group of friends had good people watching. Location leaves something to be desired--this stretch of 16th is a wasteland and is a bit sketchy late at night. We all expressed amusement at a bar selling sushi. Don't get me wrong--I love sushi--but if you're looking for a food to stave off a hang over, sushi ain't it. All in all, it as an ok night and I"d go back, but it probably isn't at the top of my list.

JofB0WipvKvTAdY51E7yPQ.review_text: everyone who works here almost always has a smile, open to a good chat when they have the time between all the patrons, and their juke playlist has a range that'll satisfy everyone. between the pool table, huge connect four game, kitchen, and large unity booths, you can't find yourself not entertained unless you're trying.

2o6x7CL7q1OA7FSwLJ8kog.review_text: I really, really wanted to like this space. The neighborhood needed a bar like Dear Mom, but unfortunately the place just didn't deliver where it counts... the drinks. Worst Old Fashioned I've EVER had in my entire life. Pretty sure the barkeep used vermouth instead of Angostura bitters, which made the drink nearly unbearable. Also, he served it to me in a rocks glass, sans the rocks. Word of advice to the owner(s): Hire bartenders that know how to properly mix a cocktail, especially a classic like the Old Fashioned.  Also ordered the French slider. Not sure what made it French, or a slider. Really just a hamburger. Was decent, but nothing to write home to Mom about. Also, listing this place in the French category is a serious stretch.  The layout is cool, but I agree with others that there seems to be a ton of wasted space.  I hate to dish out a negative review, but I want to see the place succeed and sometimes you need tough love to grow.

gji92ao5NAIrb3akKyqTZQ.review_text: It's cute. Large and open, great for casual gatherings. Wasn't too crowded but it was also Thursday after NYE. Staff are friendly, crowd was fine. I'd definitely go back.

Rv8RlO-39CGTdgx6jVqSmw.review_text: Good food, friendly service, pretty large space, but the internet jukebox douche fest keeps me from ever going here anymore. Seriously, do not go here on a weekend night if you're above 25 years old.

5OhYji5NDiWFp1j8xoNDbg.review_text: I came here on a Friday night around 10PM for a birthday and it's pretty much a hipster bar.  One star because the whole place smelled like puke the couple of hours I was there (and this place is pretty sizable).  If what I was smelling wasn't puke, it must've been some cheese and chili concoction.  Pretty gross.

dfYNTBw--CYlZbFz581kYQ.review_text: More and more friends keep planning birthday parties at Dear Mom. I think it's because it's got a good vibe, a lot of space, stiff & reasonably priced drinks, and some food options. The bar is cash only (they have a high-tech ATM) but here are some of the highlights/prices:  - can of PBR - $3 - greyhound - $6 - Moscow Mule (with good ginger beer!) - $8  Some of the waitresses are friendlier than others (one barely let my friend get two words of a question in) but they make the drinks fairly quickly so I'm typically happy. Some food highlights:  - edamame with lemon and sesame seeds - $4  - papa frites with various spices - $6 I think  - chicken sandwiches, tacos, and more  There's also a photo booth, pinball machine, and Foosball for your entertainment!  Our friend brought in cupcakes for the party and the bar didn't seem to mind. She had reserved the private room which is especially perfect for parties! I'll be back with or without birthday parties to attend...!

X_Ggdxi4F2E4yzSFl9-GEQ.review_text: First timers need to try the Papa Fritas which also can be substituted if you get a burger and fires. The lamb burger is also good.  Tons of parking especially if you drive a big truck for work.

6iShvMPfeDS3dq6grbmmbg.review_text: On a whim recommendation, I mentioned Dear Mom as a place to eat in the Mission. I knew they had a back room for small parties, and that was it. Parking was easy on Saturday dinner time. The place was rowdy, but not packed, definitely a locals hangout.. so far. They had the typical combos of PBR and a shot (whiskey or bullet - depending on your selection of poison). The order, 1/2 lb burger with side potatoes and an added fried egg.
