($12 + 1) My company ordered another burger with an egg and papa style fries (mayo sauce, cheese, and other delights ($12 + 1 + 2), and the last got a fried chicken bao ($9).  There is an ease to this place. They place hits (classics really) of the 90s era - Mandy Moore, TLC, etc., though mostly chosen from a digital juke box - which is telling of the crowd that patrons. Cut the burger in half and RUNNY EGG GOODNESS. That alone made my night. The side potatoes were crispy, slightly on the salty side, but that's easily amended with ketchup or to sponge runny egg residue. Medium rare burger was juicy, and with the egg - got messy. The bun did it's job of not being destroyed. Tried a bite of the fried chicken bao. Thought it was going to be spicy because of the red sauce, but it wasn't. Bao and chicken were fantastic, however I expected a bit more chicken. Seemed like you needed to ration it with your bites. Decent size though.  Recommend as a fun place off the beaten path, and if you want to seem cool to your out-of-town friends.

RaSq7WPbxH7Dm5yfVBAgYw.review_text: They don't do pitchers... LAME! My friends were flying in from out of town and some of my other friends were here, so we met up there. The place wasn't packed, but every seat was taken. I went up to order drinks for us and we just hung around in the area with our beers.  The customers here are snobs though. A couple got up and someone else took their  seats, but because we were standing nearby and my friend had already found a seat before they left, they told my friend it was their seat. I'm sorry, you lost your seat because you went out for a smoke and then demanded someone else to give you a seat back. I thought we were at a bar ....

PMsYObBYWQbBP8KTSPT91A.review_text: It takes 30 minutes to get a drink. No waitress, no hostess. No one cares to take your order. There is no cocktail that require any garnish such as mint, only the very basic one you get from a club like jack and coke. Beer selection is also minimum. People are not nice and don't seem to give a s* about you. Crowd is like all hipster. You can't pay me to go back there.

LhdIGJbwAgfslLaruuQq3A.review_text: Tried the food on Saturday night and am upping my review to five stars. Takeaway dish: the macaroni and cheese. It has a parmesan chip on top! It's like the chefs got ahold of my dream journal.   If my own dear mom fed me this well, I might go home more often.

pI15RINDqpXIk5492xx7PA.review_text: Dear Mom,  Thanks for pouring me multiple rum & cokes at $4 a pop. Your sticky floors may make me feel like I'm in college again but your chill bartenders remind me I'm in the real world where service can be legit.  Let's talk soon.  xoxo, Rachel

4wooaHkthPXYPektXIPkBg.review_text: Says JD: I am a man that has many buffalo chicken sandwiches, and this is maybe the best I've ever had.   Other things of note: Service is always amazing for me (tho I have heard otherwise from other people (dudes) but this is my review so...)  Many large shared tables so you have to have basic social skills to find a seat.  The pickles are not good (less one star)  The chicken sandwich is the best thing on the menu and is consistently amazing.   Good beer selection.

vptc3noadIRyqS-ZJoaKUQ.review_text: "Whoa! Are you sure there isn't a "1" in front of that drink price?"   That's what you'll say when you get your bill at Dear Mom's. Besides the competitive drink prices ($4 for mixed well, $7 beer special) the bar is large, has ample seating and a range of billiards/games.   The service was friendly and prompt. I didn't try the food but late night favs like tator tots and hot dogs are sure to taste deee-licious after a few cheap drinks. The scene is also great for hipster-watching.

EZDA0JnQXTSmUGMeDNaYxw.review_text: This bar serves the legendary pickleback: the new york wonder of pickle juice and whisky. Came with some colleagues and had a great time: good music, good-looking food, and great ambiance.

hGO5cbeAemnSyQssQ4VQlg.review_text: Great spot! Service and atmosphere was second to none. More of a hipster crowd, but I still had a great time both times I was here. Highly recommended!  Can't beat the shot and a beer special for $7.

fMUhrOBWCqy1z-TBAogpxA.review_text: I am so stoked that Dear Mom has finally opened its doors.  This warm, atmospheric bar armed with a delicious menu crafted by chef Laurent Katgely of Chez Spencer electrifies this otherwise quiet portion of 16th St.  My new favorite neighborhood spot has tasty pub fare and a nightly changing main dish.  Their ever-present Tofu Hot Dog served on a baguette toasted to perfection is infused with notes of mustard.  I used to hate mustard, but the Chef has turned me into a believer!  The dish, accompanied by fresh greens and salted fingerling potatoes, was sublime when paired with an Anchor Christmas Ale.  Drinks are always on point here.  Hats off to bartenders Oliver and Jay for their excellent customer service and heavy pours.    Lots of space to mingle with close pals or total strangers so bring friends or make some over a glass of whiskey.  Bonus for the generous bar space and jukebox.  I'll be coming here too often.

bLxJThAh2C7XeGA598xhww.review_text: They just went through a little facelift. Looks way better; a Sienna color throughout the place now and the private room in the back has a lounge feel---lots of cool black and white photos on the walls with 60's pix. It's cool without feeling pretentious....And there's a long 60's sofa (just ok comfort) with small tables and two long tables to accommodated my recent office party. Music was a little loud but they adjusted it and all went well. Highly recommend!

Z88N6qly3Dp5C06XbZ9IMQ.review_text: Dear Mom,   If you'd spend less time hipster-izing and more time flavoring (your food) I might just like you more.   Because your drinks are cheap and that's all I really ask for.   Semi-turned off,  Janice

Vt4HOP_Bjc1NrmLQ-HdBxA.review_text: Drink list is pretty decent, but good luck getting that drink. Sure, it's friday, but they're understaffed enough that a beer took 20 minutes to order, and the tacos took about 30min to arrive. Bad workflow issues, we won't be back.

Lp4FBC8lVI3cdfM2it3lnA.review_text: We just came for drinks on a Saturday might. It was def hopping. Music pumping. Drinks were cheap which was awesome. Atmosphere is very friendly and lots of crazy characters. It was a bit loud and a little crowded but I'd say its nice cuz its a big spot. Didn't try the good but wish we had

U13tLFucJNz1fNv_Xgdj0g.review_text: Ahhh, nothing like the rarity of an open, space-filled bar in San Francisco.  In the Mission area, nonetheless.  Dear Mom has a few pinball and arcade games, and it rounds out what is a very nice experience in terms of bar hopping.  Great for larger groups.

YG5EroFMYByZODecz3U_kQ.review_text: Dear Mom is like the hipster version of a frat bar. Think laid-back, sports-inspired atmosphere, only without the douchey crowd. But whatever the clientele, a frat bar is a frat bar. I prefer a place with dimmer lighting and an emphasis on cocktails, not draft beer and gargantuan shots.  Of course, my review of their cocktails may not be fair because I hadn't brought cash ... yes, Dear Mom is cash only. Boooooooooo.  I'm certainly not opposed to coming back, and perhaps I'll up my rating after sampling more of their drinks and food.

qXpEaTxiOoKtibjZoj9DPQ.review_text: Chill, cool, spacious bar in the Mission. I went here for brunch on Saturday and it wasn't packed which was nice. The service was spotty though. Our drinks came really fast (love the bartender!) but the food took almost half an hour. But it was delicious and worth it. I ordered the hash which came with two eggs, potatoes, cotija cheese and an amazing aioli. I wish they accepted credit cards!

KKiBmRUU9vzIqtzi-sd7yQ.review_text: I really like this place.  The bar has great ambiance, the beer selection was good, and they make quality mixed drinks.  The Manhattan was great!

AHz3sGxkZjAzv8uu0Q9hqg.review_text: My opinion:  overpriced asian-fusion gastropub dining.  Portion size is itty-bitty.  I went here with co-workers for a beer and food.  The atmosphere is of a local mid-scale dive bar with beer and booze (saw bottles of my fave whiskey on the shelf).  The service was decent, the food was decent, the atmosphere was dark and there was music from a juke-box playing in the background. The beer prices are pretty great!   The crowd that day were Mission Locals (prob in their 20s) congregating over some alcohol and enjoying the afternoon.  Not a bad place at all if I were in the area and in the mood for some cocktails or a beer.  I just wouldn't go back if I were uber hungry!

-BmxaEcrKfbuNuQifLiG8A.review_text: Such a disappointment.  Was giddy with excitement when I heard a cool bar/food joint was coming to the neighborhood, but everything about this place is wrong. The space is cavernous, but yet there are only five (5) tables, and the bar arrangement is awkward and bottleneck-y. Our first attempt to get some food here on a Saturday night was obviously insane, but gave it a second attempt recently at 9pm on a Tuesday and guess what, it was exactly the same -- because there are FIVE TABLES which YOU WILL NEVER SIT AT.  Moreover the menu is pretty ridiculous, just 3 or 4 items, including a "french dip slider." Also, a hot dog in a hard, crunchy baguette is annoying and gum-shredding, not gourmet.   Moreover the general vibe was just weirdly hostile, like, I sort of felt like I was going to get beat up by hipsters whose territory I had invaded. I don't mean to hipster-bash, but like, people wouldn't move aside as we tried to get through.   Why? Why did this place have to suck?

_Kt01zAkzGDjSphy7W3qOA.review_text: The transformation of El Rincoln, a shady Mexican bar, to Dear Mom, a neo hipster haven, is a stunning example of gentrification. But whatever, I'll take it.   The space is much more open than before, the people are more friendly, and it's still stumbling distance from my house.   Just don't go here at hipster o'clock, or you won't be able to move much or order anything.  Hot tip: ask for a pint glass full of mimosa during brunch. It'll cost you double but it's worth triple. Trust!!

-l-TorsR28LHE40duDEGKg.review_text: I see the potential, but for now, if you're interested in having a meal here, I'd give them a couple of weeks.  I was excited by the idea of a casual bar space with sophisticated food. Hell, if I opened a bar, itd probably be a lot like Dear Mom. So, I'm totally on board with the vibe here, I just think a couple things need to be streamlined.  Ordering at the counter and having the bartenders serve you is a little awkward.  Food sat out for a bit while the bartenders tended to other things (understandably).  And once our plates were delivered I had to get up and get my own silverware on the other side of the room; should have some at the bar to prevent that.  Space at the bar was limited-- we squeezed our way into a corner.  Which made eating the fairly fancy dishes a little awkward. Like, I dunno, I'm not sure I want to eat a whole trout with people hovering over me trying to get a drink.  I don't mind eating a slider at a bar but nothing that requires significant knife/fork action. Didn't love the fishy-flavored grits (lots of shrimp essence), but maybe that's just me.  Liked that there were three salad/veggie options, it's usually hard to get something healthy at a bar, so that's a good direction.  Cool space...too much space maybe; I'd suggest a couple more tables, if y'all are taking suggestions.  For me, it seems like a great place to bring a big group for a drink, or four.  But I think the whole dining concept needs a little more work.  Hope to give it another go once they get in their groove.

HpBvzMzchFrJ6XJmtRIsMg.review_text: I love dear mom! my favorite watering hole, here's why:  + cheap, stiff drinks($4) and local brews on tap($5)  + jukebox which takes cards (kinda a plus/minus if you have a tendency to wanna play d.j., today I charged $10 because I couldn't stop, so much to choose from!)  + games, games, & more games   + PHOTO BOOTH  + TONS of seating, lots of room to move around, high ceilings, etc. consistently busy but you can't really tell with all that space!  + laid back & friendly bartenders  + easy street parking- a rarity for a mission bar  + sweet affordable collaborations with local chefs (today I had a $8 breakfast from the fogcutter folks that was one for the books)  + cute details abound like the "did you write your mom today?" message scrawled on the outside, barrel tables, even the bathrooms are cute!

V5Th21KjUiYLJQyV-vGtpg.review_text: Dear Mom has a solid dive bar vibe.  Before midnight, this place wasn't too crowded or loud.  Although the bar area was packed, the other areas of the room were not that bad.  Of course, after midnight, the place really gets packed and walking to the bathroom really becomes quite the challenge.    This is a perfect place to hit after hitting a fancier bar earlier in the night as they are not fancy micro brewed things but canned beers like Negra Modelo and PBR.  There's a hand written menu for food which looked pretty affordable although for the life of me, how do the staff here find and deliver food in this dark cave-like atmosphere?    I was the DD so I was drinking sodas most of the time here.  I'm hoping to be back here to try the food and a PBR on a weeknight.

pKAP3HaZdehkocyWZ_6UTQ.review_text: Update: Moms are always so on top of it. ATM is up and working.

tiyVdJpo_1Bnyv9gi7V9LA.review_text: Dear Mom - the lights in your place are way too bright.  I don't get it - you have edison bulbs, the place is cool, but the lights are so bright that it reminds me of a school cafeteria or closing time when bars turn on their lights and it ruins the atmosphere.  Otherwise your place is good.

Gh7a3aAOlB2zMRocFzGEZg.review_text: Dear Mom is the spot! Shout out to Rebekah T for bringing me here :) It's so unassuming from the outside, you might not even notice it.  They've got a great selection of beers, nice bartenders, a jukebox, pool table, and a great happy hour menu. It's the basic stuff that makes a place great. And the place is huge so there's plenty of space for larger groups.  I got to try their yummy sliders but the rest of their menu looked good too. I was told it changes daily, which gives me yet another reason to come back.  By the time we left at 8, the house was jam PACKED. So get here early if you want to snatch up a coveted seat at the bar.

t_RZY__XZZgbfEmF5SrHGw.review_text: Pretty open bar but SO many people and impossible to get a drink. Nice place to just kick back and relax, but a bit out of the way. I think there are better places in the Mission and in SF as a whole...but not gonna lie, the barrels were pretty sweet. Almost like a primped up frat house

R8PjB3faVGyziWd7llQgkw.review_text: I've been wanting to check out Dear Mom since day one, and haven't had a chance til today (day 12). Everything I'd heard has been fantastic, so I was preparing myself for an underwhelming experience like when you hear Super 8 is the best movie of the year, and then it's just another monster flick that ripped off Stand By Me.   Anyway, Oliver is the coolest dude ever. He makes a mean Violet Bouregard (try it trust me). And despite what he tells you, he's more than bad jokes and overly inventive drinks.   Ambience: 10 Food: 9 Drinks: 10 Music: 9 Go-there-again-ability: 10+ Go-there-tomorrow-ness: 10+  I see myself here many many many times in the very near future.   Congrats fellas, and game on.

w3grIL6Sbcv1w_ZQAV5MWw.review_text: Dear Mom,  You had the most incredible bartender working on Christmas eve. You could be stuffier than Zietgiest and smeller than the 16th st Bart station and I would still come.  regards, cancerian

upRh352VwnipRRWsnJP8SA.review_text: I think this is an excellent bar and eatery. That last two times I've gone there, they've had a different pop up restaurant in the back. The food was excellent and it's a great place for a quick bite before a little mission bar hopping.   It has got a pretty hipster vibe but there is usually a fairly eclectic gathering of people. I also really like the aesthetic design of the interior architecture. The bar is a pretty cool T shape.   Good for groups and good for a quick bite!

mOCM896HwdM4sL961RRNHg.review_text: Pretty sure nobody has a better mix of bar food, beer, and spirits. The atmosphere is always friendly and fun. You rarely wait for anything. Oh, they also have pop-up chefs. Usually something amazing and always very local.   Did I mention games, they have games. I love this place.

3ebGuvvDgFEd5wu6GB2fWw.review_text: Dear Mom gets annoying. I don't like places that are super packed and have slow service and rude / too-busy bartenders. Also, no, ladies at the bar, I will not buy you a fucking drink.

wZG2xlICfUkJiY1NdPJH2A.review_text: LOL, my friend told me he's not cool enough to hang out here. No, no, you just aren't hipster enough to like PBR, I'll take a 21 amendment, thanks! The bouncers at the front were cool. The place was packed. The bartenders weren't the friendliest. So rumor had it, the dogs were the hot ticket on the menu. Hipsters dogs were great, but nothing really beats the bacon wrapped dog on the street corner after a night out, right? I guess I had to just check out this mission spot.

rR6WsKV5tmOhF0o-vuOeeQ.review_text: I have a recurring nightmare. I luckily hadn't had to actually live it, until I went to Dear Mom. The nightmare goes something like this: I have to go to the bathroom, but the only available one has no proper door, or lock, or there's people watching me.    I don't even know where to start with the bathroom situation at this bar! As described in other reviews, it is two toilets next to each other, with a see-through screen "dividing" them. You are also visible to anyone washing their hands as the sink is right there.   I was excited to check out this new bar, and if it weren't for the bathroom I'd have given it 4 stars. But since it's a bar, and drinking equals peeing, it's one star for botching something so basic. I was with 4 other girls and we and everyone in line were baffled.  The sign on the door didn't help. It's to comply with ADA? Riiiiight, so ALL the other public restrooms I've been in have been breaking the law...  At one point a male staff member needed to get into the closet in the restroom. I told him this wouldn't be a problem if, you know, you had some DOORS. Even the curtain at the Hemlock is way better than this.   One thing girls sometimes have to do in bathrooms is to change a tampon or sanitary whathaveyou. Should we use the men's room for this?  We wanted to stay for longer but had to leave. To find another bar where we could go to the bathroom.

FpOste6Fh4ppO7jol-JlQw.review_text: The drinks are good, the crowd is fun. What more can you ask for? In the three times I've been here I've tried their...   Beverages: Gimlet (very tasty and you can't really taste the alcohol, just feel the buzz) and shots of tequila. *Please make note and beware... these shots are XL shots meaning that they seem to be well over your typical 1oz.   Food: Papas Fritas ALL. THE. WAY. This stuff is too good. I've also had the edamame, which last time was just okay. Portions are really big so share away!   Why minus the one star? Because their food is cash only... their drinks too? I'm not sure. Their ATM charges almost $3!

PKUW9VOkdAs-FOFt0KlibA.review_text: Dear Mom,  How time flies by.  I wanted to come visit you when you first opened. Turns out when I was there with my friend chillaxing, you said you'd been open for close to two years? Tell me the bartender was drunk and my youth is not in play here.  When I think of bars on 16th, I think, closer to Valencia and Mission. This one is a bit more between Mission/Potrero Hill.   It's a bar where you can take your friends, and no matter how many you take, you all fit and can listen to each other. You don't have to walk back to the heart of the Mission to get some food, they make awesome shrimp tacos. They have a huge communal table for all your birthday party needs. It's a huge bar, I tell you.   About 6 beers on draught, full bar, and if you are lucky (like me) you will run into a hot pack of male Finns as you walk right in. Yes!

3N7jujuHSGc2Goe7s9ZB7Q.review_text: This place is the perfect place to go if you want good beer and good company. Not to mention the food is pretty darn good for bar food.  The layout is very spacious and full of big tables. It's nice and bright in there- so you won't have trouble seeing the whole place or your friends like many bars in SF. The prices are reasonable. It is kind of in a random part of the mission (by condos), but well worth it.   The best part? There is a photo booth for when you get a couple beers in you! And who doesn't like photo booths?!

u9puWE0vMhedUrIFjOQk0Q.review_text: Dear Mom, you're always so welcoming and so engaging on those Sundays when all I want to do is pretend that Monday will never come. From the fairly priced drinks to the amazing food pop ups - by the time I leave I don't usually care that I can't escape Monday's impending arrival.

gosNE62t1GQnbdITjC2bBg.review_text: Stopped by yesterday afternoon after giving up on the 40 minute wait for beer at the SF FunCheap Speakeasy Brewery event.  A little cranky, hungry, and in need of receiving a beer in a reasonable amount of time...my friends and I decided to go to Dear Mom.  I got a pint of Anchor Steam and Radeberger, along with one of the best plate deals I've had in SF.  Their $6 hot dogs are unbeatable. I was skeptical when my friends placed their orders because $6 for just a hot dog seemed a little steep.  But not only do you get an amazing steamed hot dog in a warm baguette, but you also get a delicious salad and fingerling potatoes with some aioli to dip it in. Talk about stoked.  My cynical attitude went right out the door, and some of my friends were even considering ordering seconds.

O4CcO-vP1jxSReCFeCNIFw.review_text: Food: Amazing. Ambiance: It's a bar.  Bar Games: Abundant. Service: Perfect.   Do it!

1ljC2JgUafYC9wtEUXJ3bQ.review_text: Came here on Sunday night - the night before President's Day with a couple of friends.  As per usual, I was hesitant about coming to the Mission because of my disdain of alleged hipsters.  As I begrudgingly walked into the bar, I was pleasantly surprised.  Yes, there were hipsters everywhere, but this time around, EVERYONE WAS SO NICE.  Now, my main issue with hipsters is that they tend to - as a huge generalization - give me dirty-ass looks because I over-dress like it's my job.  I wore my faux leather jacket today so I think I fit in more.  Service was fast and friendly.  The first bartender we talked to was really sweet.  He joked around with us and served us pineapple vodkas without judgment.  Since he had extra left over, he just gave us an extra shot on the house.    The second bartender was a bit more judgmental.  Gave us a "look" when we asked for Dirty Shirleys and Lemon Drops, so we just asked for IPAs.  I get that this isn't a place to get girly-ass cocktails, but I would like to order sans judgment.  Whatever, he was nice.  We severely over-tipped both of them just because.  I liked the vibes from both of them because they were talking to us like we were old friends.  OHhh there was also a decent selection of beer.  I LOVE that they had Pac Man.  I also saw the giant Connect Four, which = AMAZING.  If it wasn't so far from where I lived, I wouldn't mind coming back.

36Sa9t7qX9ptIUmIk8sJtA.review_text: I followed these guys over from the venerable Thieves Tavern.   This is a great space which is large enough to never really full too suffocating. The bartenders are true pros and the service is reliably excellent. The food is great too.

Lu8y2ayxVlAzuJEVfVcH4w.review_text: Dear Mom,   Thanks for having good beer on tap. I love bars with good taste in food and drinks and you have quickly become my favorite little Happy Hour bar to start my weekend off at. I often bring friends, because we all enjoy a good beer.   We also like playing songs on your fun jukebox and eating those tasty beef sliders with fingerling potatoes. The bathroom mural to Moms is pretty cute too. I love old family photos.   Casey is one of the nicest bartenders in town with great taste in beer. I've had the Maredsous (Belgian Ale) based on his recommendations. I love the N'ice Chouffe and the Chouffe IPA on draft as well. The Linden Street Red is also a good one they have on draft.   I love how the beers change but they have different Belgians. That's the key to my heart Mom, good times, good food and good beer.   Love, Beks.

vF9C7jqC2uPkBfTiecUeuA.review_text: That have a GIANT-SIZED game of Connect Four!!!   Oh, and a decent selection of booze.   What more do you need?

jB6gZt_YgnsJ6M1VcWXNFw.review_text: Enjoyed some drinks with my friend and her crew of family and friends last night for her birthday celebration last night. I cannot keep up with my friends and their drinking antics, like EVER-- no matter how much I eat beforehand-- so I needed to split the fried chicken sriracha sandwich and potatoes with a friend, who said he would have been better without the layer of coleslaw. Oh dear lord there's a reason why they give you a knife and a fork.  Pack some wet naps and pass them around to share because that was some messy deliciousness right there.  It gets super crowded so hope you don't mind feeling cozy in hipster nation! Fun times all around.

YFNHieKTAnKxPVbo8Y5peA.review_text: Come for the great beer. But come back for the Kale Tacos or Sriracha Buffalo Chicken.   This is a solid place to meet a large (7-20) group of people for affordable dinner and drinks. They offer much better options than your standard, heavy, pub food.

D2epirooWNjvwTI6MFhNGw.review_text: Dear Mom,   SF is great. It's so diverse. Kind of expensive to live here but whatevs.  There are tons of great places to grab drinks and tons of great places to eat.   Oh, but probably one of the best places to do BOTH is a "hipster" spot called Dear Mom (I'll explain hipster another time). There's an amazing Sriracha buffalo chicken sandwich that changed my life. If you don't believe me then you've got to get out here and try it. The hipsters might be a bit too loud for your liking late at night so maybe we will go for an afternoon beer and grab a bite?   I'm probably going to gain some weight. Oh, my wallet is a lot thinner though. This place is ca$h only.   Love and other indoor sports,   Susy.   P.S. Rum & coke floats for dessert sound good?

Z-4Ow2j7kRPyUMuxsebmvQ.review_text: Food is legit. Then you find out it's spun up with connections to Chez Spencer and you get it. Decent selection of beers at ridiculous prices.

qUJmdUBUXEy7_73Ie_CWrQ.review_text: Good place to grab a drink and bounce some quarters off the communal table.  Bao wow!

EYLy8HaGh8SzP9vZbRAFzg.review_text: Y'all, it's a bar with a kitchen, not vice versa. Great little joint. Nice folks slangin dranks. Best value for eats in SF outside of taqueria fare - and it won't inflate you with carb-farts like that thigh-sized burrito will. Avoid (OK, OK, or seek out if you must) vegan fare by checking their twitter page for weekly pop-up schedule: twitter.com/dearmomsf Wish they'd get their pool table back so we'd have an excuse to show up more often.

jB76CTiIEQDGUxnJpWBuvg.review_text: Love that it is two blocks from my work! The bartenders are soo friendly and there are a million games/distractions. I felt like a kid in there. Minus one star because you have to semi share the bathroom?? But other than that, good drinks, music, and times! Def. will be back :)

bOHNFwu8qAvWrzENXfihBg.review_text: Came here for lunch on a weekday with a friend.  We got the beef slider (bigger than a slider, really, which was good since it was $9 and came with roasted potatoes and salad) and the three-cheese farfalle. The food was delicious but took a while to come out. I think there was only one person in the kitchen?   There was only one other group of a few people but it took 10 minutes for the bartender to open 2 cans of Coke and pour them for us. He seemed a little stressed out.  They're probably still working out the "new bar kinks" so just give them some time and they'll be even better.

Wf4a2oE_GXProo_AAu1TeQ.review_text: I love, love, love Dear Mom! I've been here multiple times for drinks, but when I was choosing a place to throw my 26th Birthday, I instantly thought of Dear Mom. Even better, they have a back room you can reserve for private parties free of charge! I worked with the owner directly to plan my party and he was exceptionally kind of attentive, even giving me a free gin tasting. The bartender and staff was extraordinarily nice and all of my friends had an amazing time. We ordered finger foods like the papas fritas, edamame, and jalapeno croquettes and the open kitchen allowed my hungrier guests to order full meals. Overall, one of my best birthdays ever and I would love to throw other parties here!

m1jzeTBPmQZ1ojxHUz4scQ.review_text: I came here for a friend's birthday a few Fridays ago and was pleasantly surprised. We were with a huge group (30 people) and when we showed up at 6pm it wasn't too crowded. There was a big private room with one person sitting in there so my friend and I walked up and asked if there was anyway we could use the room. Turns out it was the owner and he was SO nice! He let us have the room and bought a birthday beer for our friend.   This was a great place to do a big group dinner becasue you walk up to the bar to order your food and drinks. There was no need to split up the bill at the end and people could come and go as they pleased. I got the chicken bao and it was SO good -- like thinking about it the next day becasue it was so good. I also tried the patatas bravas and the kale tacos, both were delicious as well. Their wine selection was minimal, as in house red or house white but they had lots of good beers on tap and cocktails.  The crowd is to be expected for the Mission, pretty hipsterish. But the staff was all so friendly and accommodating (which honesty can be so hit or miss in the Mission with people thinking they're too cool). I would definitely recommend this if someone is looking for great food in a bar type environment. Definitely a repeat!

zcomZb2vYCcZjpPqFA4Qlg.review_text: If we had one last day to live, we wanted this to be our last meal.    Me  - Kale Tacos... It doesn't sound very appealing, but they were Absolutely amazing!      My boyfriend - Siracha chicken sandwich.  He ate the whole thing in four bites and he didn't give me a bite... but he almost ate his hand it was so good.  He's still freaking talking about it tonight and we went last night.    Drinks - We only had beers, but the bartenders were awesome, beers were cheap and it was all around awesome.

xM54EZxtxKehUN_YaWC7Rw.review_text: Meh. It was fun until the droves of Yuppies showed up.    Gripes: Join this century and PUT A TELEVISION SET IN              Join this century and ACCEPT CREDIT CARDS  Probably will not go back. Too many other options with TVs that take credit.

Dhl0d-8Tgp4ihCtVc6LYSA.review_text: Cool place, mixed crowd, cheap drinks, and cash only. I don't like how it's cash only but can get over it. Other than that, it was a fun and chill night to hang with friends.

ZqEW0hByiV8PtMvHS00OIw.review_text: Great new bar converted from a shady pool hall that I walked in and out of once when trying to find an amiable bar to watch the Giants pennant race.   I was only in and out on this occasion too but the little time I spent I can say that Dear Mom utilizes its space well. It's filled with games: skeeball, pool, arcades (think I saw some?) Tunes from a Jukebox that takes credit cards (super rad) offer soundtrack for drinking. They look to have a good selection of beers.   My personal highlight was the chicken salad sandwich. It was to die for. Fresh chicken mixed in a delicious aioli (a hint of dill maybe) and arugula on the freshest baguette you'll find at a bar.   Unfortunately you may not be able to enjoy this sammie on your visit as Dear Mom's kitchen changes it menu daily and only offers one item a day. Limited but I respect their desire to do one thing right.

0Sq_p5k5MJ3_DIlzbdOmtg.review_text: Love this place!  I went there for a birthday and it was great.  The food was delicious, the atmosphere was laid back, and the bartenders/manager were amazing. We ordered the papas fritas and the tacos camerones and both were delicious!  The drinks were reasonably priced.  I will definitely be going back!

DCnWy4XBG6ZiEquVqoCLOw.review_text: I used to work nearby, and often swung by Dear Mom either for a work happy hour or for 'on-the-way-home' drinks.  I have lovingly commented to friends that this place is called 'Dear Mom' because of all of the babies who hang out there. (I'm about to turn 40, and most of the clientele is in their 20s, maybe 30s. I'm thankful I look younger than my age!)  Despite my initial reservations about this place (a place for hipster babies and bright-young-things), Dear Mom has grown on me and my fiancé-who is even 10 years older than me and a bar owner! The ambiance is cool, and it's a great place to have a shot and a beer back. Their food is super tasty--it would be great if they opened for lunch.

Jldzk3pQnaang4nhTQsGzg.review_text: I came here because i heard the food was good. i didn't know what to expect when i decided to try this place, but upon walking in, it reminded me of every bar in mission - very hipster and grungy.   Upon writing this review, i decided to urban dictionary the word grungy; because the word itself sounds dirty, but i wanted a more accurate description of Dear Mom. As UD puts it - not just dirty. Army boot dirty. Men's room floor dirty.  I guess i wouldn't say this bar was "men's room floor dirty", but it definitely gave off that vibe.  When we sat down at the bar, the servers were a little slow - ignored my friend and I for some time even though I was staring right at him. We finally got his attention and ordered 2 beers, their potatoes, kale taco (i dont know why, it sounded and was too healthy for bar food) and their chicken bao.  the best thing was probably the bao. everything else was just ok. they gave a generous cereal bowl sized of the potatoes, which i thought was nice if i wanted to gain 10 pounds.  Would come back for drinks, but not food.

lK_32lYJ-p_fjc01G-DPLw.review_text: I'd been excited to check out Dear Mom for a while, and finally made it a few weeks ago. II don't think there was a popup that night but I'm not 100% sure. Shared the steamed pork buns and potatoes with friends. Both were good but not worth the cost.

dGtsHOFYxPyJL5qK8k49kg.review_text: This bar rules they have a good selection of whiskey beer and food. Plus its close to work so if I need a break or I have to meet clients I don't have to go far. So long dive bar and hello to a nicer scale kind of place.

ms5cezvfYjEHadbvuHD63w.review_text: Cute, hipsterish bar with a good amount of space. We were here last night for a birthday and the space in the back is nice for such an event. They did, however, come and kick us out for another group which they did not inform us of ahead of time.   They serve the food from Voodoo food truck which i hear isn't bad. I'm gluten free and was told that there wasn't anything I could eat (hence the 3 stars).   My wife is vegetarian and she liked the summer tacos - "refreshing" she says.

PVpeB-fTAd5qi1vxDTSehw.review_text: Been wanting to check this spot out for quite sometime. The name of the bar I really liked and the location is close to my work. Finally came here on a warm Friday night. It was packed, young crowd - but diverse in style from Marina douchebags to tattooed hipsters, it was a good mix I suppose.  Now for the oh-so important pros - fast service, friendly bartenders, somewhat decent pricing and very large space. I hate a cramped bar.  And now for the even more oh-so important cons - super sweaty hot, no air circulation, and the lights were a lil too bright for my liking.  Food looked good - didn't try it but interesting menu - more then just your average hot wings and fries. All in all, not bad, I'd be back for an occasion.

ldBOnh5lUiiPrPhZpDjPTQ.review_text: Best bar in San Fran. Don't even bother with trying to find a place more awesome.  Good food, reasonable drinks, amazing staff.  They CARE.  Most of SF has been overrun with douchebaggery these days.  Dear Mom is an oasis.  Love, love, love.

rtd4t1APKJCWlZkZZry5Jg.review_text: I would do 3 1/2 if we could! I have only been to this bar one, but I liked it. The major problem was being overlooked by the bartenders (One was chatting up people next to us and the other was helping people who were walking up to the bar even though we had been sitting at the bar for awhile (10 min or so) and it wasn't super slammed or anything).   I am curious what their food is like as it looked pretty good.   Cash only. Large space. Fun music. And games.   I would go back and would hope the service was a little better.

_dKFcQEIOkJNzk74BPKBhA.review_text: Pretty cool, large low-key bar in the mission with cheap drinks, a pool table, some arcade games, a foosball table and a digital jukebox that allows you to select songs from your phone. I didn't try any food but it looked decent (bar food though). Would definitely come back!

6QN6BdpcDKXNS9Xq_7pECQ.review_text: not my type of scene with half hipsters and half marina crowd last night, but the door guys are hella cool.

ljtnTY6FOWvky4DXDXo_GQ.review_text: Outstanding food for a bar.  Community bench is good for larger groups.  Plenty of hipsters to punch in the face.

_rxqb3IOo_ZDrk1JUD0_AA.review_text: Came by here after a sunday night rehearsal for a few drinks with a medium size group of friends. I do understand it was a sunday evening but it was 11:30 when we walked in and they were quick to tell us we had to order immediately because it was last call. We were the last to arrive so our friends already had their drinks. The un-friendly bartender told us he could only pour us shots since he called last call. I asked for a flavored vodka (clearly displayed on the wall) and he said he couldnt get it for me, my friend asked for patron which he was also denied, so we said just give us whatever... the bartender proceeded to grab silver tequila for my friend form the EXACT shelf the flavor vodka i had requested was on. We went to pay and it was cash only ( now this is my bad i should know better in the city) so i grabbed cash from the ATM .. he took 5 minutes to get back and get my cash which i dont know why because we wasnt serving any drinks. They quickly began flashing lights and making everyone leave before they even finished their drinks. The staff was rude, and unapproachable and I never plan on returning to this bar! ICK

t1NmJ-g09NijXqycgF-evA.review_text: I drunkenly had a burger and strongbow cider here and would highly recommend both.

yLeWNfBQ45opcd7DIQMQOQ.review_text: My office employees chose this bar as a place for a going away party. I wanted to be a cool boss and buy my employees some drinks. I asked the bartender for some drinks and two old fashions that were meant to be top shelf. The bartender asked me what label I'd like for the top shelf and I explained that I didn't know anything about old fashions and if he could choose for me. He then went ahead and picked the most expensive label and charged me 35 dollars each for the two drinks. That makes 70 bucks for two drinks and he didn't tell me how much these drinks would cost or give me an option. I felt taken. I'll never return to this place based on this bartender and his attitude. It was really awful. This was last night. You cannot trust this bars staff, period.

K0Zu6TQcFWnPVE0jGrGozg.review_text: Preface: We went to this place with a group of about 30 people. Each kind of in their own subset, so about 3 groups of 10. One of those groups included children and babies. We have awesome kids in our group, so don't think that they were running around the place spilling drinks and knocking over chairs. They behaved as any drunk patron would have: they told tall tales and lacked fine motor control.  When a restaurant or bar has dozens of people show up all within about 15 minutes of each other, it usually means that their service crumbles apart and their attitudes aren't very far behind them. Not so at Dear Mom. We put in food orders and within about 10 minutes our food started streaming out from the kitchen. Our drinks were served up at the bar by great bartenders that were plenty attentive for a fairly busy night. The music was loud and awesome. Seriously, Metallica, My Bloody Valentine and Buddy Holly all fit in just fine throughout the evening. The well drinks were generous (comparing prices to a few other bars in SF, some nearby and some not). The beer selection was more than adequate. The Foosball was epic.  I had a chicken sandwich thing, it was spicy and awesome. The homemade corndogs were epicly corndoggy. The Curly fries were curled just like the hair where as a child I'd hide and pray for the thunder and the rain to quietly pass me by-yigh. The Jalapeno poppers were poppingly spicy.  Can I mention again how chill and cool the staff was? Yes, I can? Then I will. Maybe they just had the A-Team on that night, but all of our needs were met and the one flub ( a forgotten fried egg) was rectified quickly. A buddy of mine loved his burger which had the fried egg included on first attempt. Typically there's a coldness when staff see children being brought into a bar & grill... you know... like their cool spot is being encroached upon by breeding yuppies. We experienced no such cold hard stares or sneers. Instead they applied the age old practice of smiling and waiting for people to prove that they are assholes before treating them as such. Considering there's not an asshole to be found in our bunch, we had an expectedly good time and the staff were happy to have us around.  Go to this place happy and ready to enjoy a bar that at least for us on that Sunday night delivered on all the promises a bar can make: Staff that is timely, food that is not complicated and tastes great, and libations that flow nearly freely.  Kids are ok until 10pm, in case you were wondering.

sjzpz7oCW0t7m7sI_3hHeg.review_text: Who plays Vanilla Ice 2 times in a row? My opinion of this place is not a positive one. The ladies room had 2 toilets with no divider. I had a conversation with a red head lady while peeing  just to be considerate.   A woman at the bar was completely unaware that it isn't polite to swing your foot around carelessly into a crowd of people. A random pool table is awkwardly placed in the middle of open drinking space.  If I didn't get so turned off by all of it , I might of actually scoped out the beer selection.  This place is may have been appealing in college.

Om3XzO7bUOz9bkSR8bYtcA.review_text: Like the bar. Like the food. Can't stand the crowd of inconsiderate smokers they allow to hang out directly in front of the fully open large front door. Disgusting.

L8Om2473wuZK4LTxLL6RUg.review_text: I'm fawning so much over Dear Mom, they should change the name to "Deer Mom." Okay, that may've been ridiculous, but this place is no joke.  Hosted my birthday shindig here a while back and had a very lovely time. They crafted a waffle with berry jam that'd go down in the Waffle Hall of Fame. Off the hook, off the grid, off the charts. These ain't no Eggos, kids. The food here is utterly superb.   Come on Wednesdays for whiskey and a pickle back (yes, that's pickle juice chaser) from the local celebrity bartender. I'm not gherkin your chain! (Ugh, sorry about the puns.) Come any night for a game of giant Connect Four or billiards.

ipleTHGh9KR8hO5U1yxzXw.review_text: They have updated the sign to say Daily Special...which is more apropos then Happy Hour Special.   I'd pay $7 for a Jameson & PBR during the  hours of nightly bar frolicking in the Mission. I have not yet attempted a second visit to the food but the staff is nice and the beer selection is small yet solid.   I guess this just falls under the classification of bars that don't do happy hour at all.

XYLpZqLEp3eF0LnTaNAZ3w.review_text: Recently changed the stars I have this place. The beer is good and the atmosphere is fun. Devon is a great bartender and overall, the others are good too. They have food that's good with typical trendy mission prices. Cheapest thing on the menu is edamame for $4.

Rp8hHh-2U8Nh-7FhhspVxQ.review_text: Dear Mom.   You just have to love the name.  Reasons why I'd come back again: -Cool dive-y bar -Open, airy, and spacious -Pool table available -Photo booth available -Private backroom available -Juke box available -Nightly specials available (PBJ: Pabst Blue Ribbon beer & a shot of whiskey =$7) -Street parking available (easier to find parking here than in the Mission) -Lots of bar food choices:  *Daily Specials- Lamb w/ Polenta, Roast Beef, etc. *Regular dishes- Beef Sliders, Shrimp & Grits, Steamed Hot Dog, etc.  Bottom line: Cool spot to hang w/ friends and throw back a couple of beers.  Note: **CASH ONLY**

K9-4EkmJo1Qd1Pt5GCn5Hw.review_text: The bartenders are slow and have a bad attitude. People waited at the bar for over 45 min to get served. They never made eye contact and it didn't look like they had their own stations or any bartending experience for that matter. You should try other bars around this area, Dear Mom just isn't worth it.

K9E4zQSmE9KguCxCQZ42Kg.review_text: Cool place I popped in on my stroll home when visiting. Definitely a Mission hipster feel but still friendly and open. I had a couple of mixed drinks and a beer and didn't think the menu was the most voluminous, but definitely had some great options.  Service at the bar was great. I didn't have any food when I was here but everything I saw people eating looked great. It was quiet when I was there so I was able to play ping pong for a solid hour in the back room, a place that had a weird old sunken ship feel to it and I was somehow drawn to. I would definitely like to go back on a busier weekend night and see how my thoughts change.

BdcNkjxcse8y48YISk6low.review_text: For a hipster bar, and I DO mean hipster bar, Dear Mom is pretty darn cool.  It's spacious, rustic, and the bartenders know their bourbon like the Yankees know how to put together dynasties.  Adding "In Rainbows" to the jukebox was also a nice touch.

jEVqZq_r0zd9GNrxbliGag.review_text: Dear Mom,  I'm wearing skinny jeans, skinny ties and thick rimmed glasses.  I thought you would appreciate the vibe I'm bringing to your place cause I seem to fit here perfectly.  I certainly like ample space you have in your house but I don't appreciate you charging me cash only when in this modern day and age, everyone carries plastic...Even me!    I really do appreciate your cooking and your falafel burger is very tasty.  I threw a big event here with my snowboarding buddies with nearly 100 peeps showing up and you didn't mind the drinking and debauchery that ensued.  You even gave me a special on the the Chimay and a whiskey shot...You are the coolest Mom in the world!  Sincerely, Hipster guy

duymKKwUruH8GwbvcaFd0w.review_text: Jay and Oliver have put together an amazing space.  I've been by three times now and I can't wait to actually try the food since all I've done so far is drink.  It's very spacious and they have a pool table and giant Connect Four game too.  They also have an arcade machine with a bunch of old school games (Mappy, Xevious, Mr Do, Burgertime, Donkey Kong, Frogger, etc.)    Good bourbon list and other whiskys too!

T81dEo4yH-O9JUQ71-Dgpw.review_text: I love this place!!! Food is really good! I love the buffalo chicken sandwich!! I took one star away because they got rid of all the board games and giant connect four game :(

UvrnceI8CFCjoJo4iPEjUQ.review_text: hello.  i am a hipster*. (see reference below as cited from the scrupulously well known  urban dictionary)**  i also don't drink (but my friends do). the ginger ale is delicious.  as far as drinks, thats where admittedly i cannot  continue to help.  bartenders brunch on sundays is nice. yum waffles and ritual coffee. the food preparation is done alternately by various cooks/chefs/food trucks/restaurants etc.  all of the bartenders are terrific (chris is a doll) including the eager to please and down-to-earth owners; jay and oliver. great guys. not douchey. not to your face anyway.  they have a giant connect four.  video game machine.  pool table internet jukebox.  photo booth. a large space to accommodate the massive hipster encampment.  someone complained about there being too much space? really?  the difficulty in getting a drink on a busy night? it is a new bar and it is busy. wear stilts.   OR  tip a bartender REALLY well on the first round(s) and they'll remember you. speaking from previous career experience.  regarding the women's bathroom being weird and stalls separated by mere shower curtains? for some reason it is to comply with the american disabilities something or other. additionally, most girls go pee in flocks together...myself included. who cares. you probably didn't mind peeing openly at burning man...  people have mentioned the doors being open and they are cold. drink more. move. this is san francisco. sport the "double hoodie" "*** i do. because i am hip, i invented this...you're welcome. bars do this so people know they are open...especially when they are not surrounded by other bars. this isn't fine dining. they have combination specials of PBR and Jameson dude.   * by admitting i am a hipster i may have lost the title since a hipster probably wouldn't admit that.  ** "Hipsters are a subculture of men and women typically in their 20's and 30's that value independent thinking, counter-culture, progressive politics, an appreciation of art and indie-rock, creativity, intelligence, and witty banter. The greatest concentrations of hipsters can be found living in the Williamsburg, Wicker Park, and Mission District neighborhoods of major cosmopolitan centers such as New York, Chicago, and San Francisco respectively. Although "hipsterism" is really a state of mind,it is also often intertwined with distinct fashion sensibilities. Hipsters reject the culturally-ignorant attitudes of mainstream consumers, and are often be seen wearing vintage and thrift store inspired fashions, tight-fitting jeans, old-school sneakers, and sometimes thick rimmed glasses. Both hipster men and women sport similar androgynous hair styles that include combinations of messy shag cuts and asymmetric side-swept bangs. Such styles are often associated with the work of creative stylists at urban salons, and are usually too "edgy" for the culturally-sheltered mainstream consumer. The "effortless cool" urban bohemian look of a hipster is exemplified in Urban Outfitters and American Apparel ads which cater towards the hipster demographic. Despite misconceptions based on their aesthetic tastes, hipsters tend to be well educated and often have liberal arts degrees, or degrees in maths and sciences, which also require certain creative analytical thinking abilities."  *** not to be confused with (double rainbow)

XOHKDnt58mENLSjlrSHAyA.review_text: So, I've been here a time or two. The first time for a private party in the side room and a couple there after for a early Saturday night sip. Well, this last visit just blew my socks off...   I hosted a lil going away shindig in the back room for some special friends of ours. Dear Mom went way above and beyond our expectations. Set us up with some table tennis, organized the pop up trucks so we were fed throughout the event and even gave us some free plays on the jukebox. Everyone was super impressed with the service, the shots & the stellar food (Whiskey Commons rocked the pork sammy).  Needless to say, I think they really set the bar for customer service. I'll be back, again and again and again.

erZZ9K9wgdSswAm6TEh7Qw.review_text: Was invited here for a going away party, it's a bit out of the way so I wouldn't normally come here. The bar itself is cool, a very chill vibe and lots of space which is nice. They take cash only, which is annoying but I got over it. They have limited vodka options, which sucked but I was fine with it since that's just the way it was (and it wasn't expensive). My 1st vodka tonic was fine, but my second was luke warm - really, warm vodka tonic? What is wrong with this place, I was pretty much done after that. The people I was with seemed to like the food, but I didn't try it. In any event, I won't be back - I like a good vodka tonic and one that's cold!

mJHhMXJK8yWnG1CNgJKxGw.review_text: Dear Mom,   I'm sorry I wore a sheer shirt last night that you could totally see my bra  through.  Thanks for not saying anything.   I know I don't tell you enough, but I really appreciate your cheap drinks and the entertainment you always provide for my friends and I in the forms of buck hunter and photo booths.    I can't believe you let me stay up so late on a school night!  I'm also grateful you taught me well, and that I should only buy drinks with cash.  Who needs cards anyways?  I hope next time you will make me a midnight snack, those hotdogs you made the neighbors looked AMAZING.   I love you and I promise I will come back and visit soon.

1kaSMeWkDuVASaQ2A30tQg.review_text: This off the beaten track joint is a really great spot for a weekend night of drinks and hearty bar food. The bartenders are extremely friendly and the Violet Bouregard I had was fantastic. We tried the sliders and the mac n'cheese from their regular menu, and it was all tasty. Hadn't it been for the holiday spirit, I might have had to cut half a star because of the sometimes alarmingly high volume from the jukebox ... But for having been open for only 16 days, they are sure doing a fine job and I'll be back.

OONSLml-Z1Cn62Y6JyuEbA.review_text: Reading through the reviews, there is a lot of misinformation about the staff behind the Dear Mom food. They are not Chez Spencer, they are not Voodoo truck. They are Guillermo and Caroline who used to have a food truck named FogCutter. And they are DA BOMB!  Upscale bar food that is crazy inventive and awesome. Once a week there are pop-ups on Sunday, but the rest of the time they are working their tailfeathers off bringing all the drunk people fantastic food. Shout out to Sherie and Jay who also flex their chef muscles in the kitchen (Sherie is from Voodoo).   Yes, the bar is cash only, but if ya'll look around, there is an ATM right inside. It's not rocket science, it's just a bar with food, but it's a good one and you should be nice to your Mom.

-vqUxKdYbH12DsFS9Tbj1A.review_text: this place is fantastic. i think they opened about 5 days ago, and you could not tell at all that they were new. great staff, friendly service and they were quick at the bar. drink prices were great, food was amazing. welcome to the neighborhood!

3JMY7N7dsaQsjqwN5cZUVQ.review_text: This could become my favorite neighborhood bar but they need to get a better selection of IPAs. The only one they have kinda sucks and it's 5$ during happy hour.   I had a slider which was delicious but for 9$ I expected either a larger/normal size burger or a couple of them. The cook was friendly.   My biggest complaint is the lack of places to lock your bike.

NX1kf75zOXFXSwpiN7YYcQ.review_text: Bars to love are really easy to choose for me...Here's my check list... DO they have .... *Good/interesting beer selection.... CHECK *Good snacks....UHH yes ... (The menu's bomb, so far I've tried shoyu eggs [soy-marinated hard-boiled eggs with cucumber kimchi] & they were AWESOME...I'm in the process of trying more) *Good venue....yup...HUGE with large tables & a large backroom (with a picture of Sophia Loren I might add which if you know me ... beautiful ladies on your walls are a plus to your establishment) *Great location - very close to all the Mission happenings & to public transit & is very convenient to me ... *A mellow crowd *& a juke box....  What else is there to ask for???  I am kinda sad that they tore down all the awesome vintage photos & 'roids in the bathroom though...I always thought Dear Mom had the coolest bathroom bc of that but not anymore...:(

PDw6E484ow3Wp2k0_An6iQ.review_text: Bring your Mom to Dear Mom.  Good beer, music & atmosphere.

yi9eAPNgnqBGaRQ_Eyz2Aw.review_text: "Dear Mom, I came to this bar because I have been walking past it the last two years and I finally decided to stop in. Remember how you always used to say,  go with your gut instinct? I should have listened! No wonder I have passed this place for so long. It's totally wack!"   First, who told you that Jameson & PBR should be paired? I think the Jameson family and the Ricard folks would be appalled. Second, why do you have PBR on the blackboard like it's champagne? PBR is worse than Coors & Miller combined. Yes, I just said that.   My gin & tonic was more akin to diluted rubbing alcohol sprayed with lime perfume. Just downright awful.   The atmosphere reminded me of the bars near UCSB and Pepperdine. What the sign should really say, is Dear Mom, please send more money so I can party it up at the bar with watered down drinks.  No thanks, I think I'll stick with Señor Casanova.

H5EY1CeIx4m_pNChKZkq7A.review_text: Looking for a bar to kick it ..after work? Well Dear Mom, is the place to be!!  Came here on a Friday night for our Tough Mudder Reunion. Met up with Yelpers Devora, David, Peter, and Janice C. Shout out!! LOL Any who, venue is roomy and gets packed quick. Setting is kind of dark, pool table in the back and a huge bar that outlines the wall. Most importantly the drinks are good! LOL there not watered down, so please enjoy yourself.   Gotta love the name, DEAR MOM!!

YxPczw0Ge_-t2LBqzqNr2A.review_text: Dear Yelp,  I like this place.  A lot.  The bar is large and roomy and service is quick.  Their specials: typically Jameson or Jim Beam and a PBR is great.  Giant Connect Four and a pool table.  Small room in the back can be reserved for parties.  Nothing fancy but a solid place to have a drink.

4RlzFohEgBdFXUGoqvpZqQ.review_text: I came here late last Thursday. Although I hate cash only bars, I was willing to give this one a try. The space is big, open, and airy. So much so that it was pretty chilly as they kept the door open (which I totally understand, otherwise, you may not know this place is here). The bartender quickly came over to us and we got some tall cans of PBR (when in Rome...). What I really liked about this place is that there was space to sit and have a conversation, which you can't always find in this city. I'd def. be willing to come back and have a more diverse range of drinks with a big group of friends!

AU5oQS6QSwZHDyI4dJTmsA.review_text: Came here for dinner with friends--the ambiance doesn't make it the best place to have a meal but the menu is a pretty interesting blend of bar food with an Asian twist. For apps we had the edamame, papas fritas, and pickled vegetables w/ quail egg (the third being our requisite nod to current foodie trends). I also ordered a buffalo chicken sandwich since nothing is not improved by Sriracha. The edamame was a standout--sesame seeds and lemon were a nice touch.  There are a lot of comments about this being a hipster bar and while that was the case it wasn't oppressively so. Granted we were there on a Wednesday night.

wnOvtPxuET5MvxOHKCzxgQ.review_text: San Francisco hipsters managed to buy a bar.  I'm never going here again, ever. Our experience was so bad it makes me cringe every time I drive by this place (we had a terrible experience with a birthday get-together).  Dear management at Dear Mom: real businesses don't let snotty little entitled hipsters run customer service for a reason.  Oh, and the drinks were completely boring and overpriced, before we walked out.

AjHFgLursLNKyzsqG_Y4VA.review_text: Cool looking bar, pretty empty on a Sunday morning for brunch. This review is just for the food though. Probably way cooler as a bar on a fri or sat night.  Fried chicken sandwich had a nice crispy crust and tender enough, but the slaw that came with it had too much mayo for my tastes. Also the chicken batter appeared to rely more on the korean chili sauce for flavoring than spices in the batter itself.  The chilaquiles verdes was a tasty messy-looking bowl of stuff. Avocado on scrambled egg on pork shoulder on tortilla chips with salsa/sour cream/cheese all over it, and a lime on the side. Seemed like a pretty good hangover dish if that's what you're looking for. The dim interior lighting would help that, as well. ;)  We were really hoping for the fall hash as shown online, but the menu of the day was different from the example on their website, oh well. Prices are alright, however, and we definitely left full. Seems like a good spot for people in the neighborhood esp if you want something less frou frou than a mimosa to pair with your brunch, but there are lots of other interesting brunch places elsewhere in the city!

2pPNxXnyh6EDUuBJVuoQmA.review_text: I think it's a wonderful idea to have pop-up restaurant nights in the bar. They have a small kitchen space just off to the side of where the drinks are served, which they frequently rent out to up-and-coming catering companies or food trucks.   Hella Vegan Eats comes in from time to time. Those lovely individuals make some of the tastiest food. It's a shame they don't have their own restaurant yet. But I digress...  As for Dear Mom, I haven't tried their drinks yet. It's a dive bar, but not totally sketchy.   Yes, seems to be Hipster Paradise. You'll probably get a few up-and-down looks from the regulars, judging you on whether or not you're cool enough. Don't worry, they'll leave you to your business.   Seems like there aren't enough tables. The last time I was in, two booths were completely covered up with jackets and backpacks, not allowing anyone else to sit down. Not okay.

bM1vovFIegj7naEzhIRIDg.review_text: To the guy on the pool table last Saturday night:  I get it. You're a showman. You're somewhat decent at pool, and it was nice to see you keep up with me even though I walked into the bar completely hammered. No need to make snarky comments to your friends or prance around every time you put a ball in. By the way, try to give a straight answer when someone asks "who's next on the list?" A shrug and a cocky look isn't an adequate replacement for your ignorance.  The rest of the assholes in the joint were only slightly less annoying, if only for the fact that they didn't talk to me. A saving grace, indeed.  Dear Mom,   Your bar sucks.  -Love CD.

yJAkBODmbaBQnaCgMlGsbQ.review_text: Presented with a flight of interesting whiskeys, by an interesting bartender, under golden filament bulbs, on a deliberately angular counter (because everyone wants to sit at the END of the bar, says amiable owner J), this New Yorker was again plagued with Mission District envy.   Why have I never seen a full-sized pool table at a bar? Why was there seating at the bar, seating in booths, and seating around the various scattered oak barrels? Why, despite all our pomp and circumstance, can New Yorkers only muster a dilettantish penchant for amber liquor (and liquids: I asked what 'Ritual Coffee' was, and received a sad shaking of the head-) compared to West Coasters?   Dear Mom? I want to move to San Francisco.

2G9534Zx7ph7y9k_QhbMOw.review_text: Between Dear Mom and Gracias Madre I am starting to think The Mission has a serious mommy complex.

eRAiAu1ZmvagwfE565ckOw.review_text: This place is a fad. Drinks are not that cheap, its way too hipster for my taste and they close too early.

h9NqARoD3oR5p4z5p6uJzA.review_text: This would totally be my neighborhood bar because:  --it's 2 block from my house --they have good & cheap beers (we're talking $4) --it's spacious but doesn't feel too big --large U-shaped bar --there's a pool table --chill, relaxed environment --they have food  But it's NOT my neighborhood bar (yet) because: --it's always crowded --I don't know the bartenders (that's important if it's gonna be "your" neighborhood bar) --I can never order food because all the seats are taken --the cookies are $2, and they suck --they don't have any of my favorite IPAs on tap (probably the most important)  I'll still go all the time though! It's a new bar to the mission, so I don't blame everyone for wanting to try it. AND they can always add some good IPAs to their menu...

YP8WqkDOhkir9Tj3K5U94g.review_text: Hipsters unite. Menu served 24/7. Good beer selection.  I haven't tried any cocktails here but know that some of the bartenders are reputable from other bars.  PBR-themed home-made Connect-Four would be great if they had a full set of pieces.  It made for a very disappointing game due the premature end.  Their website is through facebook ... Foul play.

3G9Jkn7hKc8fmbdK8_lC8g.review_text: I dig this place! BUT I went at a time that wasn't crowded and we had a big table to sit at so that could've made a huge difference. had it been an extra crowded night I might have a different story. it seemed pretty spacious and chill. the food was more than decent and the bartender wasn't a hassle to get a hold of. I've yet to come for a popup but fully intend to.

OnFVuSyFNX_f0C606KXH7A.review_text: Three of us went for a snack and everything was amazing!  The cuban style sandwhich was packed with flavor, the banh mi was fresh and delightful, and the gumbo was sooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo fantastic!

hkEmdF3NXVS7H4CzSDlqkw.review_text: This might be one of my new favorite bars in the Mission for the papas fritas alone. The potatoes (they're too thick to be called fries) come covered in chili powder, lime, chives and cotija cheese, and I apologize if reading that made you drool all over your phone.  The drinks are stiff and there's a surprising amount of floor space for a Mission bar. Entrees are decent, I had the falafel burger which was plenty tasty, although it wilted into a tzatziki sauce mess within a few seconds of picking it up. (No worries, burger salad is just as tasty.)  The place is cash-only, but you're in the Mission, so you can't be surprised. It's a bit of a hipster magnet, but don't worry, they're only pretending to like it ironically. Try this out!

kcT0hcsvvl2F7VomQ8yoEQ.review_text: Came here on a Wednesday night (apparently they close at midnight during the week).  It was 11:30.  Ordered a beer.  At 11:45 I was told to chug my beer and get the hell out.    "Can I please finish my beer?  I'll be out by 12."   NO.  GET OUT.  Worst. Customer Service.  Ever.

yb2erMSDuAAl7-KRnPX_RA.review_text: ehhhh this is my personal opinion...if you are hipster youd love it! No my scene, quiet, lame no music! boring!!

7-6e12HAy1XIT2pG1pMFhw.review_text: I drive up and down 16th St. a lot and always wondered what's up with that odd building on the corner - part bar, part dump, part art project.  Well, Ante Meridian did a pop-up brunch that sucked us past our doubts and into DM.  What a pleasant surprise.  This feels like it would be a great hangout. The room is open, not cramped, with a nice big bar and some bar entertainments about.    The AM pop-up was great.  Especially the rice porridge with pork, poached egg, kimchee and spinach cream.  YUM. One of the best congee-style creations I've enjoyed... WINNER!   Check out Ante Meridian if the pop up on your radar, and don't be a dork like me and prejudge a place by it's neighborhood and facade.

KEPtqEP50ibJNwCOxTwJFQ.review_text: So many hipsters! Things I love: The BURGER & FRIES, drooling just thinking about them. The foosball, The amount of seating, The photobooth, the jukebox the atmosphere  Things that need work: beer selection, not much variety on tap

__05rytNjsye9MBhqB0DMA.review_text: Great  bar. The burger I ordered was prepared how I asked. Medium rare with all the juices running out. The beers that I had were good.  Plus the whiskey shot for four roses bourbon was a good palette cleanser.    I like this bar and will be a return customer when I am in the neighborhood.

xRWRDXapx5HYVIxi9tqSjQ.review_text: Came  here after work and had some nice drinks and food. It was a nice spot for after work drinks because it was relaxing and good music. We had their fries, which were more like chunked up potatoes with cheese on them. They were so very good. The rest of the menu looked really good. I'll for sure come back to try more food.

WWhxtBLG2FVRv8n5K0HnWg.review_text: I wish Dear Mom was closer to my house, because I'd then be able to drink there 5 times a week at least! This is hands down one of my favorite bars in the city. Jay and Oliver go above and beyond with customer experience. I've never felt so welcome at a bar as I do here. The food is excellent, and the whiskey selection is huge. Every time I recommend it to a friend, they always text me later with how much fun it was and how much they love the place.

zst5ol5eBsx-Uz6wfKDzAA.review_text: Right off the bat, 5 stars for food. I've only had the burger and salad that comes with it, but they were really, really good. Surprisingly good frankly.   The bar leaves something to be desired. The bar itself is a mess of a design. It's a zigzag, not a long straight bar, so you can't see any brands that they carry on the back bar. Unless you have remarkable vision.   It's cheap so that's good for some. But I always wonder what's going in my drink if it can warrant it being so cheap. So I stick to beer. It looks like they have an interesting, off the beaten path beer selection.   And the bartenders. Wow. 5 stars for our girl with the glasses and really pretty eyes, but one star for all the rest.   This place, like most Mission Hipster type places, hire people with distain for everyone that isn't like them. Tattooed all over, poor, or poor looking, ratty unkept hair, bizarre sense of "style", if you can even call it that.   And we even heard a couple of the bartenders talking shit about the rest of the staff, their job in general and hating working there, and about customers, right to their face.   It was, in short, comedy to watch.   It's new, so it's busy. And it'll probably lose a little of their following due to the overall poor service and attitude.   I'll be back for the burger.

UJkhP7wNRUW9KzYektCtuA.review_text: I've only ever been here at night, but it is pretty poppin' most of the time.  Couldn't tell you what kind of music they play but it isn't weird, they have pool AND ping pong tables, and last, but definitely not least, they have a photo booth.  Every bar needs a photo booth.  The only drawback is they seriously need a bigger bar/ more bartenders, but doesn't everyone?

DkFR-AE68Nr0jRR8mKQmlA.review_text: Dear Mom is pretty right on.  Nice whiskey selection, didn't try any food but the German pilsner I had was nice.  Roomy and friendly place as I experienced it.  Probably the best thing going in the immediate area.

KDewJBJknfWvQyHHFNbfdg.review_text: Preface: I remember the first time I started to drink coffee in bars. It was shit. Pure sludge of an experience. In the good way. Indianapolis, Indiana. Red Key Tavern. Shit coffee on deck. Smoking cigarettes, drinking shit coffee with Wanda Jackson on the jukebox.   The scene is covered. The lighting. The beers and cocktails. The big tables. The pool table. The food. The din. The location. The friendliness. All covered. What has been missed in the past year of reviewing Dear Mom? Well, something that comes together to create something that doesn't exist anywhere else in the city outside of your home or your office:   1. Ritual coffee on deck -- free refills. I repeat. Ritual coffee. Free refills.  2. Free wifi.  3. Big tables.   What's that create? That creates a work environment. That Rituatl coffee is brewed by the batch and it looks like they're doing bulk pour overs? Also, their water boiler is more adorable than R2D2. It's true.   I'm not going to abuse the privilege of these guys pouring free refills, so I'll be tipping well and I won't be here every day to work or even every weekend, but when I'm in the mood to work here with friends, I'm coming. And I can't say that this enviornment -- with refills -- exists anywhere else.

a5bVNQAqI_oYrHq0oLMGkQ.review_text: Surprisingly great! Went there for brunch n it was really good. Chill atmosphere. I will go back.

Kqef_0Rtq4W-Bp7S_Wn-GA.review_text: This, in my opinion, is one of those hipster bars with a random name. I must admit that it was not bad, though! it is the perfect place to chill in a group and have a beer. I got ID'd for the first time, so that was a milestone for me. Besides drinks, beers and shots, they also serve food: tacos, burgers, fries and edamame! I had a kale taco, and it was interesting because the avocados in it had a red (spicy I think) powder on it. Also the two small slices of watermelon served with the tacos were covered in it. Do not know what it was but it had a unique (spicy) flavor. The ambience was very casual and the place was a bit crowded. Because of where it is located, it really does not look like a bar until you are up close, so do not give up and look around if you are trying to find it!

0zvXh6uOzQQxxB3g0zfeYQ.review_text: They say Dear Mom is closed at the moment, but that's because the internet doesn't know everything.  My mother is the greatest person that ever lived.  I'm not sure how to live without that fact beating in my chest every moment of every day.  I run anxious, so I think alcohol, as Joan Didion says, is the most effective anti-anxiety agent known to man, aside from a living, loving mother.  My mother, and the occasional drunken adventure, combined with my life as an artist is what saves me day in and out.  Thank you for creating a bar that commerorates everything worth loving in life. Also thanks for boss bartenders, a location that serves the fringe, and everything else that makes us sound and happy.  Here's to the way yelp should be.

jhlypqpD38ms7mlIyPwzcQ.review_text: Such a fun spot - cheap drinks, super nice bartenders (who are also the owners), games, big booths, plenty of room to stand and mingle, AMAZING food from that window in the back - I've been here a few times with a few different groups of friends and everyone said the same thing - let's go back soon!!!!!

iLjMdZi0Tm7DQxX1C1_2dg.review_text: If there were an Advent Calendar that spanned roughly six months, but featured shots of Jameson and tall cans of PBR instead of mediocre chocolates and visions of sugar plums dancing in heads, trust I would have swooped it up the second I learned of Dear Mom's plans to take over the old El Rincon space in the middle of 2011 as a way to celebrate my impending excitement. After a few bumps in the road delaying their original opening date, they're up and running now, and I couldn't be more thrilled. Being the bar fly that I am, I've been looking forward to Oliver and J's new project since being tipped off at their former place of employment, Thieves. And after my first visit over the weekend, it was everything I'd hoped for and more. The space is huge (which is a bit of a rarity in this city), the Edison bulbs rappelling from the rafters give off a warm, inviting vibe, the staff is quick and efficient behind the racks, and most important of all, they've curated quite the lovely group of people to enjoy a drink around. Chalk it up to their impressive network of family and friends, but on the night I dipped in, I couldn't help but notice how good looking and energetic the crowd seemed to be. That may be a shallow observation, sure, but it is what it is. That's not always the case if you frequent enough watering holes around the city... Being a neighborhood bar, they're darn near always open. Currently, they're open for roughly 12 hours a day beginning at 11:30am, and they've tasked the folks behind Chez Spencer with supplying bar bites that'd pique the interest of any self-proclaimed epicurean food snob. They feature a daily specialized entree Monday - Sunday with corresponding price points, they have a roster of permanent comfort food fixtures, and it looks as though they have a pretty fun little brunch set up for the weekends as well. Have yet to treat my palate to a taste of what they have to offer, but already being a fan of Chez Spencer, I can only imagine I'll enjoy every last morsel. Though I love the coordinates of where my apartment sits, a genuine locals hang like this is enough to provoke me to peruse Craigslist just to see if there are any available rentals within stumbling distance. Maybe the best thing to happen to society since Callin' Oates (callinoates.com)? Only time will tell.

-qnZYtMnvPt4XWYH5oXDUw.review_text: Rad corner hipster bar in the Mission District.  No cover charge, on a Saturday night?  Sounds good to me!    The place was really chill, lively at the same time...  Nice laid-back attitude.  Dim lighting, but not so much that I couldn't see the people I was talking to.  Great mix of music, some old stuff, some new stuff, R&B, 90's Hip Hop, Pop, some Alternative.    Even though there were a lot of people in here, finding a place to sit at the community table or in a booth seemed to not be a problem at all.  The bar was crowded though, and for brief moments it seemed almost impossible to get a bar tender to help us, but after the surge I saw the perfect opportunity to order a round of beers.  $5 for a Blue Moon.  Not too bad.  Yes, you can almost buy a six pack for that amount, but in San Francisco, on a Saturday night I have never paid that little for an adult beverage.  I was a very happy camper.   The bao that my friends ate looked delicious.  I didn't try any of their food offerings while I was here, but my friends devoured them!  Worth visiting again.

O48Zm9ZWPxG4yiouRtdOeQ.review_text: This was a tough one for me, I really wanted to love this place. I wanted a large space for my friend and I to celebrate our birthdays, very laid back, chill, fun. And Dear Mom definitely hit all of those points. Also great location. So if you're a beer drinker that likes open space, games and fun, stop here and give yourself the 4 star benefit. If not, keep reading and see why it dropped to a 2.   First of all, the drinks were terrible. Not just a little watery or a little too strong, bad. My friend sent hers back, I quickly switched to a bottled beer and at least 3 friends had the same opinion. Even their "specialty" drinks were not well made. My Beauregard was bitter, overly strong and not at all tasty.   Second of all, the food was overpriced and bland. For bar food, I want it to be delicious or cheap. Doesn't have to be both. I'm willing to pay for something different, but this was bland pasta, bland shrimp and grits, crunchy stale cookies, and a nothing special salad. Not worth it.   Finally, we happened to be there on a freezing day and they would not, no matter how many times we asked or closed the doors ourselves, allow the doors to be closed. A number of friends left because they were too cold.

jsxNHAaLcHkkd3QYG5xSzg.review_text: nice place, fairly easy parking by car, much easier parking by bike, as there is a space full of bike racks right out front!   Bartender was super busy, didn't look like he had much help.  It was kinda weird though, he was eating food from a bowl on top of the bar in between serving drinks and taking money.
