Like take a couple bites, serve some drinks, take a bite, etc.   drinks were good, average prices, but on our 2nd round of drinks we each had a bug in our glasses, so that was bad. Dude was very cool to take them back and give us new drinks in clean glasses though.   totally plus 1 star for having the Hella Vegan Eats girls making some really good food back in the kitchen there.

xpyElLYq-hHTA0VVQXra8w.review_text: First night and I'm already a fan. What a perfect combination...  with the backing of Whiskey Thieves owner, his two best bartender's Jay & Oliver have started their own place. They bring the gift of making you feel welcome while Chez Spencer's owner/executive chef Laurent Katgely supplies the menu. The result: you have the perfect hang out spot where you you can get high-end bites. See you again at Dear Mom!

6_VkzelWeSHzjTVDlGl-Ug.review_text: ATMOSPHERE Has ping pong table in the back! I think they put it away last time tho. Middle of Mission area, I've stumbled in here few times whilst on the drunken mission. har har. Otherwise, a spacious basic place for drinking.   11/1/13

Y6AnR_5l_RgdSM-GDsqRgA.review_text: I'm back in action ! Dear Mom....  - Hipster Bar  - Dim lights - Cash Only - 1 Pool table - Serves food - Wide selection of beer - Closes at midnight  HIGHLIGHT: Wednesday nights they have pickle back !! WHOA !! Can't go wrong with a shot of Jameson and pickle juice !! One of my most favorite drinks!!

F2_vU0hLpKMYhZG8X0Fztw.review_text: Convo with my co-worker on our way to Dear Mom:   Co-worker, "I'm really glad that we have a place that's easy to walk to for a drink after work and we don't have to walk, like, 8 blocks to the Mission. They're not regular blocks either; we have to walk through the dirtiest part of the in-between to get there..."  Me, "Me too. It's a good change from the Double Play. Also, I was always afraid to go into the bar that used to be Dear Mom because it looked like one of those places where I wouldn't come back out..."  So, yeah, Dear Mom is a welcomed establishment to the 'hood. The space is a lot bigger than I imagined and the design of the bar is optimized so that there are plenty of corner seats, which my friend explained to me is prime real estate (I did not know...) I started getting into whiskey last year so I'm excited that there's a wide variety here to try. They even serve food, so lunching here is most likely in my future.  I came in around 5:30, when it was still quiet, but it filled up pretty quickly come 7ish, and even when it did get really busy, the bartenders were still attentive and friendly. I've mentally bookmarked Dear Mom as a regular spot.

TlcOomCmGcPc6u-HzOq4dg.review_text: + Killer Manhattans, solid beer selection + Gourmet Chez Spencer hot dog in a hollowed out french baguette w/potatoes and salad for $6 + Large central bar you can ogle strangers across  + Great space, great booths

c2IcHHOTgQXf-9AA0DLLRw.review_text: Hire some bartenders you moron management.    Other than that comment, I liked this place.  Chill, away from the mess of Mission, and just a chill local bar.    Was peeved we went there on a Friday at like 6PM, was not busy at all, but enough for the 2 bartenders to be overwhelmed.  If your business is selling drinks, why wouldn't you try to be good at your business?

fxJcpYyCBgi61PtmlZXTjQ.review_text: If you like Whiskey Thieves, Thieves Tavern and/or the Blind Cat (fka Dirty Thieves) but wish they had grubbin' food, way more space, a private room and were in Potrero Hill, this is the place for you! The fourth edition to the former Thieves trifecta is a very welcome addition with its spacious interior, pool tables, central bar with lots of seating and it's large private room which makes up for in communal beer-hall style seating what it lacks in a private bar. The food menu is classic pub food done gourmand-style, their bourbon/whiskey selection and knowledge of their bartenders about it is just what you'd expect, and their Manhattans and sazeracs are on par with the Whiskey Thieves - in other words, very strong and expertly made.  Why only four stars? Like their counterparts, this bar is CASH ONLY. A huge pet peeve of mine when I'm spending lots of money on high-end bourbon. Also, the night we were here for a long-announced private party with scores of guests, the ATM was out of order. Fail. Luckily, it's not a long walk to the Potrero Hill shopping center. Also, the women's bathroom has a very odd and IMHO unacceptable set-up: there's two toilets but they're only separated by a screen that you can see right through so no one is going to leave the door unlocked so a second girl (or anyone else) can let themselves in to use the second completely unshielded toilet. If anything, I guess it's good for facilitating girls going to the bathroom in pairs as they often do anyway. Still, installing real stalls would be a big plus.

3iefE-Wn9RKGmS78GdRiOg.review_text: This is a the perfect place a pirate party. They have the space where all your friends can get dressed up a like a pirate and party like rock stars...  The food is you typical bar food but over all it was fun. I am sure I will not be writing my mom to tell her what I saw.  I was caught of guard when the kitchen was all cash. So if you are hungry make sure to hit the ATM...

4ZaqBJqt7laPPs8xfWvr6A.review_text: Very fun, slightly "hipster" bar.   Came here for my friend's birthday & had a great time.   There was ample room to dance and to sit (large tables in the back, booths, and barrels to plop down on - very cool!)  There is a counter where you can order delicious food items like gourmet hot dogs (see photo), cheesy potatoes, burgers, etc - YUM-O! Exceeded my expectations. CASH ONLY!  The only thing that could be improved was the sound quality/volume of the music. There was really only one place (by the photo booth/video game stand) where you could hear it loud and clear.   I will be back ;)

AGraTma9eEgsiJFDIy6tbg.review_text: I cannot wait to come back here for fried chicken bao and beer!  Love it!  That's all I would have - ok, maybe a salad to be a little bit healthy, but the fried chicken bao is a MUST HAVE!  The ambiance is ok, a bar scene, sort of dark with big tables to enjoy your bao and beer.  They have a nice beer selection - that's all I need, really!  Go to the bar and order up and they will bring your food and beer cheerily.  Hmmm, when can I go to Dear Mom next?  :)

CZ36wJqV-Xit758UaOr81A.review_text: When you walk into Dear Mom your first impression is "This place is SO Mission". It's divey yet hip. It's industrial yet chic. It's, well, very hipster. This joint is a fairly large open space with a pretty big bar sitting in the middle. With large tables littered all of the place, Dear Mom is a casual spot to grab a bite - perfect for big parties. Decked out with distressed wood, dark tones and little hints of color throughout (they have a few bouquets of fresh flowers), this place is screaming "kickback". Think of the ideal place to grab a bite with your closest buddies before hitting the town. That's exactly what Dear Mom is. SHOT OF WHISKEY & A 24 OZ PABST BLUE RIBBON ~ $8 ~ 4 stars: I thought this was a great deal. You get a shot of mid-shelf whiskey. Not sure what kind it was but I did see the bottle and it wasn't well. Usually a shot will run you $6-$8, at least. So it was pretty awesome to get a 24 oz Pabst Blue Ribbon on the side to enjoy after you main vein the whiskey. THE BURGER w/ BACON, WHITE CHEDDAR & FRIED EGG ~ $17 ~ 4 stars: The burger by itself is $12. After adding bacon ($3), white cheddar ($1) and fried egg ($1), my tab came out to an even $17. I love how tax is already built into their pricing - I hate carrying loose change. The burger also comes with a side of fat home fries. They were the perfect starchy compliment to my ultra juicy and delicious burger. The bacon, egg and cheese paired so well with the FAT burger patty. Cooked medium rare, it was the perfect burger to soak up any booze you plan on consuming that night. Served on a soft bun, pickled cucumbers and lettuce, this thing is a must have. I absolutely loved it. Excuse me for the slightly blurry picture. I was already buzzed. yelp.com/biz_photos/dear… Everyone got the burger except for my friend Adam. He got the Sriracha Buffalo Chicken Sandwich. Although I didn't try it, I must say it looked and smelled amazing. He also scarfed that thing down in a flash so I'm assuming he dug it. A few other Yelpers have also given the chicken sandwich props so I'll be sure to try it next time. Don't be afraid to pick your favorite tracks on their jukebox and play a game of foosball while waiting for your food. Awesome place. Good food. Nice bar. Dear Mom, I love you.

Y03E-SGURjA65yXvCYQtDA.review_text: Great beer and great service.  The vibe is laid back.  There is always good energy, yet there is always a good place to stand and you'll get a drink quickly from the bar.  One of the best bars in San Francisco hands down.

n4JfQLR3ZyVhUizKCDgdLg.review_text: Got dragged here however, the food is very good, am always surprised about how much good food there is in the mission.  Other than the food, it's a bar in the Mission, if that's your thing, this place is great, if it's not, this place is not

scIyLRiFryYbzCcJG5l1Fg.review_text: Great new(ish) bar in the Mission.   Let's just say this is not an undiscovered spot. A complete clusterf*#k. Wow the hipsters spread the word quickly.  I really like the place but it was slammed so it did take forever to get a drink. The bartenders were hustling but it was tough for them to keep up and I totally understand.  The lighting was cool and its nice to offer the pool and foosball table. On the Saturday I was there the music was a bit all over but who doesn't like to hear David Bowie back-to-back...maybe it's a juke box.   Drink prices seemed okay.   Next time I'm in the Mission I'll probably stop in.

qIDy9zJfCuqxy6A3exPe_w.review_text: I love the style of Dear Mom. It can get hipster but you have to expect that since it is in the mission. It's also kind of in the middle of no where in the mission so there is plenty of parking nearby. It is also cash only so be prepared to hit the ATM before you go.  They have picnic style communal tables and a very large bar on the left. I had my usual red bull vodka, but they have a wide array of beers and liqueurs. You can play foosball, pay the juke box to play a song.  Fun place for a big group.

UZPHtlRP3v6qM6hvMcQ0kw.review_text: Bar is pretty cool, however I will say this place has been getting a little bridge and tunnel over the weekends. I would recommend checking it out during happy hour or during the week. Super down to earth bar-tenders and AWESOME Bloody Mary's. The music is often shit during the weekend nights when the bros and bro-hoes roll through but during the mellow hours you can hit the jukebox and spin some sweet jams, after that you could hit the pool table. I love this bar, I think this place might be owned by the same peeps who own Thieves, next to boxdog.

TiPH2ZwSX53uK7IvFSHVYg.review_text: The chicken sriracha sandwich with potatoes were really good! They also had the fried potatoes bowl, watermelon, and etc. The edamame was decent but nothing too amazing. The best was by far the porkbelly bao...OMG perfect mix of crispy and juicy. I love sprouts that came with it. Ths servers here are very friendly and I always get the same white ale. My bf really likes the random specials they have too.

hIKZzXX_GExXe_NrHFXVMg.review_text: Great spot, especially for a large group given all the space. Agree with other reviewers tha tthe music is a little on the loud side. I had the hot dog - it rocked!

DdVubY9qgnPZ9lhtjJOtWA.review_text: Fun spot. I love that they have food too. But this is a bar that has food, not a restaurant with a bar. Usually pretty packed, diverse crowd. Good location
